original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug pa'i rim pa ni kham gyi zas ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug pa'i sgo yin pas dang por bstan to //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug pa'i rim pa ni kham gyi zas ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug pa'i sgo yin pas dang por bstan to //
translated: The order of the applications of mindfulness is taught in this way: the first is taught because the food of morsel is the door of entry to the application of mindfulness to the body.

original: reg pa'i zas ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug pa'i sgo yin pas de'i 'og tu @55a * //üîΩbstan to // yid la sems pa'i zas ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug pa'i sgo yin pas de'i 'og tu bstan to //
analyzed: reg pa'i zas ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug pa'i sgo yin pas de'i 'og tu @55a * // bstan to // yid la sems pa'i zas ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug pa'i sgo yin pas de'i 'og tu bstan to //
translated: The second is taught because the food of contact is the door of entry to the application of mindfulness to feeling.üîΩThe third is taught because the food of mental volition is the door of entry to the application of mindfulness to mind.

original: rnam par shes pa'i zas ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug pa'i sgo yin pas de'i 'og tu bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i zas ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug pa'i sgo yin pas de'i 'og tu bstan te /
translated: The fourth is taught because the food of consciousness is the door of entry to the application of mindfulness to dharmas.

original: de ni zas rnams kyi go rims rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni zas rnams kyi go rims rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the order of the foods.

original: de la zas rnams kyi bsdu ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zas rnams kyi bsdu ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the order of the inclusion of the foods?

original: kham gyi zas ni gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pas de ni gzugs kyi phung po'i chos gang dag bsdus pa de dag bsdus so //
analyzed: kham gyi zas ni gzugs kyi phung por gtogs pas de ni gzugs kyi phung po'i chos gang dag bsdus pa de dag bsdus so //
translated: The food of morsel is included in the form aggregate, so whatever dharmas are included in the form aggregate are included in that.

original: reg pa dang yid la sems pa'i zas ni 'du shes kyi phung por gtogs pas de gnyis kyis ni 'du byed kyi phung pos chos gang dag bsdus pa de dag bsdus so //
analyzed: reg pa dang yid la sems pa'i zas ni 'du shes kyi phung por gtogs pas de gnyis kyis ni 'du byed kyi phung pos chos gang dag bsdus pa de dag bsdus so //
translated: The nutriments of contact and mental will are included in the aggregate of conceptualization. Therefore, they include those things included in the aggregate of karmic predispositions.

original: rnam par shes pa'i zas ni rnam par shes pa'i phung por gtogs pas des ni rnam par shes pa'i phung pos chos gang dag bsdus pa de dag bsdus par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i zas ni rnam par shes pa'i phung por gtogs pas des ni rnam par shes pa'i phung pos chos gang dag bsdus pa de dag bsdus par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The nutriment of consciousness is included in the aggregate of consciousness. Therefore, it should be understood that it includes those things included in the aggregate of consciousness.

original: de la gnyid dang yang ba spangs pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag kyang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: de la gnyid dang yang ba spangs pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag kyang dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed pa yin na /
translated: Sleep, lightness, celibacy, and meditative concentration also nourish the faculties and the great elements.

original: ci'i phyir zas yin par rnam par mi gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zas yin par rnam par mi gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are they not posited as nutriments?

original: rgyas par ni gnyis po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: rgyas par ni gnyis po 'di dag yin te /
translated: There are two kinds of nourishment:

original: don gzhan la phan 'dogs pas rgyas pa dang / gnod par mi byed pas rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: don gzhan la phan 'dogs pas rgyas pa dang / gnod par mi byed pas rgyas pa'o //
translated: nourishment through benefitting another object and nourishment through not harming.

original: de la gnyid la sogs pa ni rgyas pa phyi ma shos kyis rgyas par byed pa yin gyi /üîΩsnga ma shos kyis ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gnyid la sogs pa ni rgyas pa phyi ma shos kyis rgyas par byed pa yin gyi / snga ma shos kyis ma yin te /
translated: Sleep and so on are not posited as nutriments because they are not nutriments that are primary,

original: de'i phyir de dag zan yin par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag zan yin par mi gzhag go //
translated: but are secondary nutriments.

original: ci'i phyir lus gnas par byed pa'i srog gi dbang po zas yin par rnam par mi gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lus gnas par byed pa'i srog gi dbang po zas yin par rnam par mi gzhag ce na /
translated: Why is the faculty of life force, which maintains the body, not posited as a nutriment?

original: de ni zas med na rgyas par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni zas med na rgyas par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not cause growth when there is no nutriment.

original: gang gi tshe rgyu bdun gyis 'du byed rnams gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu bdun gyis 'du byed rnams gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: When do formations remain due to seven causes?

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: skye ba dang / srog gi dbang po dang / zas dang / sems la dbang ba rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa dang / sngon gyi las kyis 'phen pa dang / bar du gcod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang / srog gi dbang po dang / zas dang / sems la dbang ba rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa dang / sngon gyi las kyis 'phen pa dang / bar du gcod pa med pa ste /
translated: They are birth, the faculty of life force, nutriment, the supernatural power of controlling the mind, the assembly of causes and conditions, the projection of previous karma and the absence of obstruction.

original: rgyu bdun po de dag gis 'du byed rnams gnas par gyur pa dmigs pa de'i tshe ci'i phyir sems can skyes shing 'byung ba rnams zas bzhi po kho nas @55b gnas par gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu bdun po de dag gis 'du byed rnams gnas par gyur pa dmigs pa de'i tshe ci'i phyir sems can skyes shing 'byung ba rnams zas bzhi po kho nas @55b gnas par gsungs te /
translated: When conditioned states are observed to endure due to these seven causes, why is it said that sentient beings who are born and arise endure due to the four nutriments alone?

original: zas bzhi ni mang ba'i phyir dang / brda phrad sla ba'i phyir dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir dang / srog gi dbang po 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug pa'i sgo yin pa'i phyir sems can skyes shing 'byung ba rnams zas bzhis gnas pa kho na yin par gsungs te /
analyzed: zas bzhi ni mang ba'i phyir dang / brda phrad sla ba'i phyir dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir dang / srog gi dbang po 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la 'jug pa'i sgo yin pa'i phyir sems can skyes shing 'byung ba rnams zas bzhis gnas pa kho na yin par gsungs te /
translated: It is said that sentient beings who are born and arise endure due to the four nutriments alone because the four nutriments are numerous, because they are easily understood, because they benefit, because they hold the life faculty, and because they are the door for engaging the foundations of mindfulness.

original: de ni zas rnams kyi bsdu ba rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni zas rnams kyi bsdu ba rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the categories of nutriment.

original: de la zas rnams kyi rten rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zas rnams kyi rten rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of the basis of nutriment?

original: kham gyi zas ni gzugs kyi phung por gtogs la reg pa dang yid la sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i zas ni ming gis bsdus pa'i phung po yin pas de dag gi rten dang / sngar gzugs kyi phung po ni gnas drug la brten te 'jug la ming gis bsdus pa'i phung po bzhi po dag ni gnas bdun la brten te 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar te ;
analyzed: kham gyi zas ni gzugs kyi phung por gtogs la reg pa dang yid la sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i zas ni ming gis bsdus pa'i phung po yin pas de dag gi rten dang / sngar gzugs kyi phung po ni gnas drug la brten te 'jug la ming gis bsdus pa'i phung po bzhi po dag ni gnas bdun la brten te 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar te ;
translated: The four aggregates included in name are supported by the seven bases, as explained above.

original: de ni zas rnams kyi rten rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni zas rnams kyi rten rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the bases of the foods.

original: de ltar zas rnams kyi rten rnam par gzhag pa ji skad bstan pa de dag gis sems can skyes shing 'byung ba rnams gnas shing tshor bar 'gyur ba'i phyir des ni de 'byung ba'i dngos po bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zas rnams kyi rten rnam par gzhag pa ji skad bstan pa de dag gis sems can skyes shing 'byung ba rnams gnas shing tshor bar 'gyur ba'i phyir des ni de 'byung ba'i dngos po bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe things that cause their arising‚Äù indicates the things that cause the arising of sentient beings who are born and appear through the bases of the foods as they have been presented.

original: de'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po zhes bya bas ni bden pa rnams bstan te /
analyzed: de'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po zhes bya bas ni bden pa rnams bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe things that cause their affliction and purification‚Äù indicates the truths.

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: the truth of suffering, the truth of the origin of suffering, the truth of the cessation of suffering, and the truth of the path.

original: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa yang rnam pa drug gis bstan te /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa yang rnam pa drug gis bstan te /
translated: Their formulation is taught through six topics:

original: ngo bo nyid dang / don dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / go rims dang / bsdu ba dang / rten gyis so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / don dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / go rims dang / bsdu ba dang / rten gyis so //
translated: nature, meaning, classification, sequence, summary, and basis.

original: de la bden pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bden pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the truths?

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bden pa rnams bstan te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bden pa rnams bstan te /
translated: The truths are taught beginning with the truth of suffering.

original: de la bden pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la bden pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four truths.

original: sdug bsngal la 'phags pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa sdug bsngal brgyad dang gsum gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la 'phags pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa sdug bsngal brgyad dang gsum gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The nature of the truth of suffering is that which is included in the eight kinds of suffering and three kinds of suffering, which are the defilements of birth.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon @56a * //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon @56a * //
translated: The nature of the truth of origin is the defilement of the passions and the defilement of actions.

original: mongs pa dang / sred pas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mongs pa dang / sred pas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is included in the aggregates of sensation, perception, and conditioning factors.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba ma lus par spangs pa nyon mongs pa 'gog pa dang / phung po 'gog pas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba ma lus par spangs pa nyon mongs pa 'gog pa dang / phung po 'gog pas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The nature of the truth of cessation is that which is included in the cessation of the afflictions and the cessation of the aggregates, which is the complete abandonment of suffering and its origin.

original: lam gyi bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba spong ba 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang / rnam par dag pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba spong ba 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang / rnam par dag pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The nature of the truth of the path is that which is included in the path of accumulation, the path of preparation, and the path of refinement, which is the noble eightfold path that abandons suffering and its origin.

original: de ni bden pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bden pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the natures of the truths.

original: de la bden pa rnams kyi don rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bden pa rnams kyi don rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of the meanings of the truths?

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two:

original: nges pa'i tshig dang / dgos pa'o //üîΩde la nges pa'i tshig ni ci'i phyir bden pa zhes bya /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig dang / dgos pa'o // de la nges pa'i tshig ni ci'i phyir bden pa zhes bya /
translated: the verbal definition and the purpose.

original: ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya /
translated: What is the verbal definition? Why are they called truths? Why are they called noble truths?

original: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal dang / 'gog pa dang / lam zhes bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal dang / 'gog pa dang / lam zhes bya /
translated: Why are they called suffering, origin,üîΩcessation, and path?

original: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba bden pa dang / 'gog pa bden pa dang / lam bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba bden pa dang / 'gog pa bden pa dang / lam bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called the truth of suffering, the truth of origin, the truth of cessation, and the truth of the path?

original: bden pa zhes bya ba'i don ni bstan pa dang mi mthun pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don dang / de mthong na rnam par dag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: bden pa zhes bya ba'i don ni bstan pa dang mi mthun pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don dang / de mthong na rnam par dag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of truth is the meaning of the characteristic of non-contradiction with what is taught, and the meaning of becoming the cause of purification when seen.

original: ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called the noble truths?

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i don ni 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa de dag chos nyid kyi sgo dang / rtogs pa'i sgo gnyi ga nas de kho na lta bu yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen cing gzigs kyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i don ni 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa de dag chos nyid kyi sgo dang / rtogs pa'i sgo gnyi ga nas de kho na lta bu yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen cing gzigs kyi /
translated: The meaning of noble truth is that those truths of the noble ones are just as they are, both from the perspective of the door of reality and the door of realization, and are known and seen by the noble ones just as they are.

original: byis pa rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes mi mthong bas na /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes mi mthong bas na /
translated: But because childish beings do not know and see them as they are,

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i don zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i don zhes bya ste /
translated: they are called the noble truths.

original: byis pa rnams la yang de dag chos nyid kyi sgo nas ni don med mod kyi /
analyzed: byis pa rnams la yang de dag chos nyid kyi sgo nas ni don med mod kyi /
translated: Although they are not true in the sense of being real,

original: rtogs pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin gyi /
translated: they are not true in the sense of being unreal.

original: 'phags pa rnams la ni de gnyi ga'i sgo nas bden pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la ni de gnyi ga'i sgo nas bden pa yin no //
translated: But for the noble ones, they are true in both senses.

original: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path?

original: sdug bsngal gyi don ni nyon mongs pa las 'byung ba'i 'du byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi don ni nyon mongs pa las 'byung ba'i 'du byed do //
translated: The meaning of suffering is the formative forces that arise from the afflictions.

original: kun 'byung ba'i don ni sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i don to //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i don ni sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of origin is the generation of suffering.

original: 'gog pa'i don ni de gnyi ga nye bar zhi ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i don ni de gnyi ga nye bar zhi ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of cessation is the pacification of both of those.

original: @56b lam gyi don ni don gsum po de dag sgrub pa'i don to //
analyzed: @56b lam gyi don ni don gsum po de dag sgrub pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of path is the means of attaining those three goals.

original: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba bden pa dang / 'gog pa bden pa dang / lam bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba bden pa dang / 'gog pa bden pa dang / lam bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path?

original: sdug bsngal yang sdug bsngal ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang sdug bsngal ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of suffering is suffering.

original: lam gyi bar yang lam gyi don gyis yang dag pa de bzhin pa ma nor ba ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bar yang lam gyi don gyis yang dag pa de bzhin pa ma nor ba ste /
translated: The path is also a path because it is the correct, suchness, unmistaken,

original: phyin kyi ma log cing ma bslad pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin kyi ma log cing ma bslad pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyis mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: unreversed, and unadulterated meaning of the path, and because it is undeceiving by way of its own characteristics.

original: de la dgos pa ni ci'i phyir bden pa rnam par gzhag pa yongs su bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de la dgos pa ni ci'i phyir bden pa rnam par gzhag pa yongs su bstan zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of the presentation of the truths?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is taught in order to present the causes and results that are included in the categories of thorough affliction and complete purification.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The truth of suffering is the result that is included in the category of thorough affliction.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The truth of origin is the cause that produces it.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The truth of cessation is the result that is included in the category of complete purification.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni de thob par byed pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni de thob par byed pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The truth of the path is the cause that attains it.

original: de ni bden pa rnams kyi don rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bden pa rnams kyi don rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the meaning of the truths.

original: de la bden pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bden pa rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of the classification of the truths?

original: rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: rnam pa drug ste /
translated: There are six types:

original: ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i rab tu dbye ba dang / yid la byed pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i rab tu dbye ba dang / yid la byed pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang /
translated: the classification of their natures, the classification of direct and indirect, the classification of their opposites and antidotes, the classification of their mental states, the classification of their realizations,

original: 'bras bu thob pa'i rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa'i rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: and the classification of the attainment of their results.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of their natures?

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa sdug bsngal brgyad dang gsum gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o zhes bstan pa de la skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa sdug bsngal brgyad dang gsum gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o zhes bstan pa de la skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gang /
translated: The nature of the truth of suffering is that which is afflicted by birth and is included in the three kinds of suffering and the eight kinds of suffering.üîΩWhat is afflicted by birth?

original: sdug bsngal brgyad ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal brgyad ni gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight kinds of suffering?

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas khams gsum du skye'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas khams gsum du skye'o //
translated: The defilement of birth is the defilement of the three realms of existence, due to the defilement of moral defilement and the defilement of action.

original: de'i 'og tu rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Subsequently, the classification is determined by way of four aspects:

original: rab tu dbye ba dang / sdug bsngal ba @57a * //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba dang / sdug bsngal ba @57a * //
translated: the classification, the suffering,

original: dang ; ma nyes pa dang / 'jug pas so //
analyzed: dang ; ma nyes pa dang / 'jug pas so //
translated: the non-reprehensibility and the engagement.

original: de la rab tu dbye ba ni ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la rab tu dbye ba ni ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The classification is fivefold:

original: khams kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / 'gro ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / gnas gzhan gyi rab tu dbye ba dang / rigs kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / 'jig rten na lus kyi rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: khams kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / 'gro ba'i rab tu dbye ba dang / gnas gzhan gyi rab tu dbye ba dang / rigs kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / 'jig rten na lus kyi rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: the classification according to realm, the classification according to destiny, the classification according to abode, the classification according to spiritual lineage and the classification according to body in the world.

original: de la khams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni khams gsum du skye ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la khams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni khams gsum du skye ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The classification according to realm refers to the three kinds of birth in the three realms of existence.

original: 'gro ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'gro ba lngar skye ba rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni 'gro ba lngar skye ba rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: The classification according to destiny refers to the five kinds of birth in the five destinies.

original: gnas gzhan gyi rab tu dbye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na gnas gzhan sum cu rtsa drug dang / gzugs kyi khams na gnas gzhan bco brgyad dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na gnas gzhan lnga bcu rtsa brgyad du skye'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhan gyi rab tu dbye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na gnas gzhan sum cu rtsa drug dang / gzugs kyi khams na gnas gzhan bco brgyad dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na gnas gzhan lnga bcu rtsa brgyad du skye'o //
translated: The classification of places is as follows: in the realm of desire, there are thirty-six places; in the realm of form, there are eighteen places; in the realm of the formless, there are five places.

original: rigs kyi rab tu dbye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na mi rnams la skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: rigs kyi rab tu dbye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na mi rnams la skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The classification of families is as follows: in the realm of desire, humans are born in three ways:

original: rigs ngan par skye ba dang / rigs btsun pa dang / rigs ngan pa yang ma yin btsun pa yang ma yin par skye ba dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams la yang skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: rigs ngan par skye ba dang / rigs btsun pa dang / rigs ngan pa yang ma yin btsun pa yang ma yin par skye ba dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams la yang skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: in a low family, in a high family, or in a family that is neither high nor low. The gods who experience desire also are born in three ways:

original: lha ma yin du skye ba dang / sa gzhi la brten pa'i nang du skye ba dang / nam mkha'i gzhal med khang la brten pa'i nang du skye ba'o //
analyzed: lha ma yin du skye ba dang / sa gzhi la brten pa'i nang du skye ba dang / nam mkha'i gzhal med khang la brten pa'i nang du skye ba'o //
translated: in the family of the antigods, in the family of the gods who live on the earth, and in the family of the gods who live in the celestial palaces in the sky.

original: gzugs kyi khams na yang skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na yang skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: In the realm of form, there are three kinds of birth:

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi 'du shes dang bcas par skye ba dang / 'du shes med par skye ba dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi gnas gtsang mar skye ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi 'du shes dang bcas par skye ba dang / 'du shes med par skye ba dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi gnas gtsang mar skye ba'o //
translated: birth in the pure abodes of noble beings.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na yang skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na yang skye ba rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: In the formless realm, there are also three types of birth:üîΩbirth among those with vast discernment,üîΩbirth among those with immeasurable discernment, and

original: 'du shes rgya che ba rnams kyi nang du skye ba dang / 'du shes tshad med pa rnams kyi nang du skye ba dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'du shes rgya che ba rnams kyi nang du skye ba dang / 'du shes tshad med pa rnams kyi nang du skye ba dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba ste /
translated: birth among the gods of neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: de dag bsdoms na rigs bcu gnyis su skye ba'o //
analyzed: de dag bsdoms na rigs bcu gnyis su skye ba'o //
translated: When combined, these make twelve types of birth.

original: 'jig rten na lus kyi rab tu dbye ba phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa dag na gnas pa rnams kyi skye ba tshad med pa dag yin par rig par bya'o /
analyzed: 'jig rten na lus kyi rab tu dbye ba phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa dag na gnas pa rnams kyi skye ba tshad med pa dag yin par rig par bya'o /
translated: In the world, the classification of bodies is to be known as the immeasurable births of those abiding in the immeasurable world systems of the ten directions.

original: de la sdug bsngal ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni yun ring po nas skye ba de dag 'gro zhing 'khor ba rnams kyi yan lag dang nying lag bcang pa mang po nyams su @57b myong ba las khrag 'dzag cing 'bab pa dang / der pha ma dang /üîΩphu nu dang / bu sring gi phyir sdug bsngal ba dang / gnyen bshes dang / nor dang / longs spyod zad pa mang po nyams su myong ba rnams kyis mchi ma mang po 'dzag cing 'bab pa dang / de dag tu ma'i nu zho 'thungs pa yang rgya mtsho chen po bzhi'i chu bas kyang ches mang ngo zhes gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal ba'i rab tu dbye ba ni yun ring po nas skye ba de dag 'gro zhing 'khor ba rnams kyi yan lag dang nying lag bcang pa mang po nyams su @57b myong ba las khrag 'dzag cing 'bab pa dang / der pha ma dang / phu nu dang / bu sring gi phyir sdug bsngal ba dang / gnyen bshes dang / nor dang / longs spyod zad pa mang po nyams su myong ba rnams kyis mchi ma mang po 'dzag cing 'bab pa dang / de dag tu ma'i nu zho 'thungs pa yang rgya mtsho chen po bzhi'i chu bas kyang ches mang ngo zhes gsungs pa dang /

original: de la ma nges pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni skye ba de dag tu 'gro zhing 'khor ba rnams kyi pha dang ma'i mtha' thug pa med pa dang / pha ma dang / phu nu dang / bu sring dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang /
analyzed: de la ma nges pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni skye ba de dag tu 'gro zhing 'khor ba rnams kyi pha dang ma'i mtha' thug pa med pa dang / pha ma dang / phu nu dang / bu sring dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang /
translated: The classification of birth as indefinite refers to those who transmigrate and circle in samsara, for whom there is no end to fathers and mothers, and there is no one who has not been a father, mother, brother, sister, preceptor, teacher,üîΩguru or guru-like person.

original: bla ma dang / bla ma lta bur ma gyur pa med pa dang / gang zag gcig gi rus pa'i phung po yang sdud pa zhig yod la bsdus kyang 'jig pa dang / rul bar mi 'gyur du zin na ni ri ngos kyi dpangs tsam mo zhes gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: bla ma dang / bla ma lta bur ma gyur pa med pa dang / gang zag gcig gi rus pa'i phung po yang sdud pa zhig yod la bsdus kyang 'jig pa dang / rul bar mi 'gyur du zin na ni ri ngos kyi dpangs tsam mo zhes gsungs pa dang /

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni skye ba'i ma nges pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni skye ba'i ma nges pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Understand that such statements are the classification of birth as indefinite.

original: de la 'jug pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni skye ba de dag tu 'gro zhing 'khor ba rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / don dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / go rims dang / bsdu ba dang / rten rnam par gzhag pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni skye ba de dag tu 'gro zhing 'khor ba rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / don dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / go rims dang / bsdu ba dang / rten rnam par gzhag pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The analysis of engagement should be understood as the nature of dependent origination, the meaning, the analysis, the sequence, the summary, and the presentation of the support for those who go to those births and revolve in samsara.

original: de la sdug bsngal brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight sufferings?

original: skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang /
analyzed: skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang /
translated: The suffering of birth, the suffering of old age, the suffering of sickness, the suffering of death, the suffering of encountering what is unpleasant, the suffering of separation from what is pleasant, the suffering of not obtaining what one desires,

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: and in brief, the suffering of the five aggregates of clinging.

original: de la ji ltar na skye ba sdug bsngal ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na skye ba sdug bsngal ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is birth suffering?

original: rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five aspects:

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / mi 'dod bzhin du 'bral ba'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / mi 'dod bzhin du 'bral ba'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is associated with suffering, because it is associated with the process of degeneration, because it is the basis of suffering, because it is the basis of the mental afflictions, and because it is the nature of being separated from what is desired even though one does not want to be separated from it.

original: rga ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal nyid yin te /
analyzed: rga ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal nyid yin te /
translated: Aging is suffering in five ways:

original: @58a * // gzugs bzang ba yongs su nyams pa'i phyir dang / mthu stobs yongs su nyams pa'i phyir dang / dbang po yongs su nyams pa'i phyir dang / yul longs spyod pa yongs su nyams pa'i phyir dang / tshe yongs su nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @58a * // gzugs bzang ba yongs su nyams pa'i phyir dang / mthu stobs yongs su nyams pa'i phyir dang / dbang po yongs su nyams pa'i phyir dang / yul longs spyod pa yongs su nyams pa'i phyir dang / tshe yongs su nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the degeneration of a good physical appearance, the degeneration of strength, the degeneration of faculties, the degeneration of pleasures, and the degeneration of life.

original: na ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: na ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal ba nyid yin te /
translated: Sickness is suffering in five ways:

original: lus kyi rang bzhin 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mngon par 'phel zhing de la shas cher gnas pa'i phyir dang / yul gyi longs spyod yid du 'ong ba mi 'dod pa'i phyir dang / yul gyi longs spyod yid du 'ong ba mi 'dod bzhin du yongs su spyad dgos pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: lus kyi rang bzhin 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mngon par 'phel zhing de la shas cher gnas pa'i phyir dang / yul gyi longs spyod yid du 'ong ba mi 'dod pa'i phyir dang / yul gyi longs spyod yid du 'ong ba mi 'dod bzhin du yongs su spyad dgos pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because the nature of the body changes, because suffering and mental dissatisfaction increase and remain in the body, because one does not desire the enjoyment of pleasant objects, because one must enjoy the objects of desire even though one does not desire them,

original: srog gi dbang po dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because one is separated from the faculty of life.

original: 'chi ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'chi ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal nyid yin te /
translated: Death is suffering in five ways:

original: longs spyod sdug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / rtsa 'jing sdug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / lus sdug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang /
analyzed: longs spyod sdug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / rtsa 'jing sdug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / lus sdug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang /
translated: because one is separated from the enjoyment of pleasant objects, because one is separated from the enjoyment of one‚Äôs home, because one is separated from the enjoyment of one‚Äôs retinue, because one is separated from the enjoyment of one‚Äôs body,üîΩand because one is separated from the enjoyment of life.

original: 'chi ba'i tshe sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba rab tu drag po nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i tshe sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba rab tu drag po nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal ba nyid yin te /
translated: Also, contact with the unpleasant is suffering in five ways:

original: de dang phrad pas sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba nyid kyi phyir dang / chad pas 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir dang / nyam pa bzhin du 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir dang / chos dang 'gal bas ngan 'gros 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang phrad pas sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba nyid kyi phyir dang / chad pas 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir dang / nyam pa bzhin du 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir dang / chos dang 'gal bas ngan 'gros 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it causes suffering and mental dissatisfaction, because it is the basis for fear of punishment, because it is the basis for fear of death like a condemned criminal, and because it is the basis for fear of lower rebirths due to violating Dharma.

original: sdug pa dang bral ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: sdug pa dang bral ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal ba nyid yin te /
translated: Also, separation from the pleasant is suffering in five ways:

original: de dang bral bas mya ngan skyes pa nyid kyi phyir dang / smre sngags 'don pa nyid kyi phyir dang / lus la gnod pa nyid kyi phyir dang / yon tan rnam pa lngas rjes su dran zhing 'dod pas yid yongs su gdung ba nyid kyi phyir dang /
analyzed: de dang bral bas mya ngan skyes pa nyid kyi phyir dang / smre sngags 'don pa nyid kyi phyir dang / lus la gnod pa nyid kyi phyir dang / yon tan rnam pa lngas rjes su dran zhing 'dod pas yid yongs su gdung ba nyid kyi phyir dang /
translated: Because of the arising of sorrow due to being separated from them, because of lamentation, because of physical pain, because of mental anguish due to recollecting and desiring them,üîΩbecause of the loss of their characteristics, and because of being a vessel for the suffering of being separated from what is dear.

original: de'i longs spyod mtshan nyid kyi phyir dang / sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyi snod nyid kyi ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal yang rnam pa de lngas @58b sdug bsngal ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i longs spyod mtshan nyid kyi phyir dang / sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyi snod nyid kyi ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal yang rnam pa de lngas @58b sdug bsngal ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The suffering of the suffering of the five appropriated aggregates should be understood as suffering in these five ways.

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal nyid yin te /
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal nyid yin te /
translated: In brief, the five appropriated aggregates are suffering in five ways.

original: mngon par grub pa'i sdug bsngal gyi snod nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / mngon par grub pa la brten pa'i sdug bsngal gyi snod nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi snod nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi snod nyid yin phyir dang /üîΩ'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par grub pa'i sdug bsngal gyi snod nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / mngon par grub pa la brten pa'i sdug bsngal gyi snod nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi snod nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi snod nyid yin phyir dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis of the suffering of birth, the basis of the suffering of old age, the basis of the suffering of sickness, the basis of the suffering of death, the basis of the suffering of association with what is unpleasant, the basis of the suffering of separation from what is pleasant, the basis of the suffering of not obtaining what one longs for, and the basis of the suffering of the five aggregates of grasping.

original: de la skye ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i tshe na lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba 'byung ba la bya'i //
analyzed: de la skye ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i tshe na lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba 'byung ba la bya'i //
translated: The suffering of birth is the feeling of physical and mental pain that occurs at the time of birth.

original: skye ba nyid ni sdug bsngal ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba nyid ni sdug bsngal ma yin te /
translated: Birth itself is not suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi gzhi ni de yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gzhi ni de yin no //
translated: It is the basis of suffering.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i bar yang 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba 'byung ba la bya'i /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i bar yang 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba 'byung ba la bya'i /
translated: Similarly, the suffering of poverty is the feeling of pain that occurs due to poverty.

original: 'dod pas phongs pa nyid ni sdug bsngal ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pas phongs pa nyid ni sdug bsngal ma yin te /
translated: Poverty is not suffering,

original: sdug bsngal gyi gzhi ni de yin no zhes snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gzhi ni de yin no zhes snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: but the basis of suffering.

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa de dag gi rnam grangs dag gi sdug bsngal kho na yin te /
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa de dag gi rnam grangs dag gi sdug bsngal kho na yin te /
translated: In brief, the five appropriative aggregates are suffering.

original: sdug bsngal brgyad po de dag kyang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal brgyad po de dag kyang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The eight sufferings should be understood as being distinguished by the defilement of birth.

original: de la sdug bsngal gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three kinds of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the formative forces.

original: skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal zhes smos pa dang po lnga'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / rga ba'i sdug bsngal dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal zhes smos pa dang po lnga'o //
translated: The first five are the suffering of birth, the suffering of aging, the suffering of sickness, the suffering of death, and the suffering of encountering what is unpleasant.

original: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
translated: What is the suffering of change?

original: sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal zhes smos pa bar ma gnyis so //
analyzed: sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal zhes smos pa bar ma gnyis so //
translated: It is the suffering of being separated from what is pleasant and the suffering of not obtaining what one longs for.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
translated: What is the suffering of the composite?

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes smos pa tham ma gcig go //
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes smos pa tham ma gcig go //
translated: In brief, it is the five aggregates of attachment.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ni dang po bdun gyis bstan to //
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ni dang po bdun gyis bstan to //
translated: Moreover, the suffering of suffering is indicated by the first seven sufferings.

original: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal la ni bdun po de dag las drug gi gnyen @59a * //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal la ni bdun po de dag las drug gi gnyen @59a * //
translated: The suffering of change is indicated by six of the seven.

original: po dkar po'i phyogs drug po rga ba'i gnyen po nad med pa dang / 'chi ba'i gnyen po gson pa dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i gnyen po sdug pa dang / sdug pa dang bral ba'i gnyen por mi sdug pa dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: po dkar po'i phyogs drug po rga ba'i gnyen po nad med pa dang / 'chi ba'i gnyen po gson pa dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i gnyen po sdug pa dang / sdug pa dang bral ba'i gnyen por mi sdug pa dang bral ba dang /
translated: The antidote to aging is good health, the antidote to death is life, the antidote to encountering what is unpleasant is to encounter what is pleasant, the antidote to being separated from what is pleasant is not being separated from what is pleasant, the antidote to not obtaining what one longs for is to obtain what one longs for, and the antidote to desire is the absence of desire.

original: 'dod pas phongs pa'i gnyen po 'dod pa phun sum tshogs pa gang yin pa rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pas phongs pa'i gnyen po 'dod pa phun sum tshogs pa gang yin pa rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The remedy for the suffering of deprivation is the abundance of the desired objects.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The suffering of conditioned existence is as previously explained.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal sngar bstan pa'i rten du gyur pa phung po ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i phung po sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal sngar bstan pa'i rten du gyur pa phung po ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i phung po sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: In brief, the suffering of suffering and the suffering of change are the suffering of conditioned existence, which is other than the previously mentioned aggregates that are the basis of suffering.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa de dag ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa de dag ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal zhes bya ste /
translated: The suffering of conditioned existence is that which is neither suffering nor happiness.

original: sdug bsngal gsum po de dag kyang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yin par rig pa par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum po de dag kyang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yin par rig pa par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that these three kinds of suffering are the classification of the defilement of birth.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba ji skad bstan pa de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba ji skad bstan pa de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The reality of suffering, which has been explained in terms of its classification, is also summarized in eight aspects.

original: shin tu rgyas la bsrabs pa dang / shin tu rgyas la bsrabs pa yang ma yin ma bsrabs pa yang ma yin pa dang / bar ma ma bsrabs pa dang / bsrabs la ma bsrabs pa dang / ches bsrabs la ma bsrabs pa dang / shin tu ches bsrabs la ma bsrabs pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu rgyas la bsrabs pa dang / shin tu rgyas la bsrabs pa yang ma yin ma bsrabs pa yang ma yin pa dang / bar ma ma bsrabs pa dang / bsrabs la ma bsrabs pa dang / ches bsrabs la ma bsrabs pa dang / shin tu ches bsrabs la ma bsrabs pa dang /
translated: very much reduced and not reduced,

original: sdug bsngal ma yin la sdug bsngal du snang zhing bsrabs pa tshen por nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma yin la sdug bsngal du snang zhing bsrabs pa tshen por nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: and not suffering but appearing as suffering and reduced.

original: de la dang po ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa'o //
translated: The first is the suffering of those in the desire realm who have not accumulated the roots of virtue.

original: gnyis pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa'o //
translated: The second is the suffering of those in the desire realm who have produced the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation.

original: gsum pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa'o //
translated: The third is the suffering of those who have accumulated the roots of virtue in the desire realm in order to be free from attachment by means of the mundane path.

original: bzhi ba ni gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa rnam par spangs pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi ba ni gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa rnam par spangs pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the suffering of those born in the form realm who have abandoned the factors conducive to liberation.

original: lnga pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa rnams par spangs pa rnams @59b kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa rnams par spangs pa rnams @59b kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa'o //
translated: The fifth is the suffering of those born in the formless realm who have abandoned the factors conducive to liberation.

original: drug pa ni slob pa bzhi mthong ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: drug pa ni slob pa bzhi mthong ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa'o //
translated: The sixth is the suffering of the four learners who have seen the truths.

original: bdun pa ni mi slob pa phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa rnams kyi srog gi dbang po'i rkyen gyis mid dang gzugs gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdun pa ni mi slob pa phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa rnams kyi srog gi dbang po'i rkyen gyis mid dang gzugs gang yin pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the life faculty and form of those nonlearners with residual aggregates.

original: brgyad pa ni byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa ni byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa ste /
translated: The eighth is the suffering of the bodhisattva who has attained the perfections and who is born in cyclic existence through his vow.

original: de ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the analysis of the reality of suffering.üîΩThe reality of the origin is the defilement of the passions and the defilement of actions, both of which are included in craving.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa sred pas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o zhes bstan pa de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gang /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa sred pas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o zhes bstan pa de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gang /
translated: What is the defilement of the passions?

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gang /
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gang /
translated: What is the defilement of actions?

original: sred pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: sred pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is craving?

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so ;
translated: The defilement of the passions is the passions and the secondary passions.

original: / de dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa dgus rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: / de dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa dgus rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Their analysis is established in nine aspects.

original: ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyu dang / gnas skabs dang / sgo dang / che ba dang / phyin ci log dang / rnam grangs dang / nyes dmigs kyi so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyu dang / gnas skabs dang / sgo dang / che ba dang / phyin ci log dang / rnam grangs dang / nyes dmigs kyi so //
translated: greatness, perversion, synonyms, and disadvantage.

original: de la ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of defilement?

original: chos gang skye ba na bdag nyid rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du skye la /
analyzed: chos gang skye ba na bdag nyid rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du skye la /
translated: It is the arising of a certain thing which is by nature unpeaceful.

original: de la skyes pas 'du byed kyi rgyud kyang rab tu ma zhi ba zhi ba kho nar 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la skyes pas 'du byed kyi rgyud kyang rab tu ma zhi ba zhi ba kho nar 'jug pa'o //
translated: When it has arisen, the stream of formations is not peaceful, but moves on in a state of unrest.

original: rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is its classification?

original: nyon mongs pa drug dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mang po dag gi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa drug dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mang po dag gi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: It is the classification of the characteristics of the six defilements and of the many secondary defilements.

original: rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is its cause?

original: rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: rnam pa drug ste /
translated: It is of six kinds:

original: rten dang / dmigs pa dang / 'du 'dzi dang / bshad pa dang / goms pa dang / yid la byed pa las nyon mongs pa skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rten dang / dmigs pa dang / 'du 'dzi dang / bshad pa dang / goms pa dang / yid la byed pa las nyon mongs pa skyes pa'o //
translated: defilement arises from the basis, from the object, from distraction, from talk, from habit, and from attention.

original: gnas skabs gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang zhe na /
translated: What is its occasion?

original: rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun te /
translated: It is of seven kinds:

original: bag la nyal dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / kun brtags pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa dang / chu ngu dang / 'bring dang ; chen po'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: bag la nyal dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / kun brtags pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa dang / chu ngu dang / 'bring dang ; chen po'i gnas skabs so //
translated: medium, and strong states.

original: sgo gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgo gang zhe na /
translated: What is a door?

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds:

original: kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal gyi sgo'o //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal gyi sgo'o //
translated: the door of entanglements and the door of latent states.

original: che ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: che ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is great?

original: rnam pa drug te /
analyzed: rnam pa drug te /
translated: There are six kinds:üîΩfalling,üîΩbirth,üîΩcause,üîΩbasis,

original: ltung ba dang / skye ba dang / rgyu dang / gzhi dang / las kun nas slong ba dang / mthar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba dang / skye ba dang / rgyu dang / gzhi dang / las kun nas slong ba dang / mthar gyur ba'o //
translated: activity, and culmination.

original: phyin ci log dang @60a * //
analyzed: phyin ci log dang @60a * //
translated: What is perversion?

original: zhe na ; rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: zhe na ; rnam pa bdun te /
translated: There are seven kinds:üîΩthe four perversions,üîΩand the perversions of ideation,

original: phyin ci log bzhi dang / de dag la 'du shes dang / lta ba dang / sems phyin ci log tu gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhi dang / de dag la 'du shes dang / lta ba dang / sems phyin ci log tu gyur ba'o //
translated: view, and thought.

original: rnam grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam grangs gang zhe na /
translated: What is a synonym?

original: rnam grangs mang po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs mang po 'di lta ste /
translated: There are many synonyms, such as:

original: kun nas sbyor ba dang / 'chi ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: kun nas sbyor ba dang / 'chi ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag go //
translated: the fetters, death, latent tendencies, secondary afflictions, entanglements, and so on.

original: nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the disadvantage?

original: nyes dmigs rnam pa du ma 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyes dmigs rnam pa du ma 'di lta ste /
translated: The disadvantage is the many kinds of harm, such as:

original: sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / dmigs pa la phyin ci log par byed pa dang / bag la nyal ba brtan par byed pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyun 'jug par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa dang / dmigs pa la phyin ci log par byed pa dang / bag la nyal ba brtan par byed pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyun 'jug par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag go //
translated: the afflictions of the mind, the perversions with regard to the object, the solidification of latent tendencies, the continuation of the stream of compositional activity that is the cause of the result that is similar to the cause, and so on.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi mngon par 'du byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi mngon par 'du byed pa rnams so //
translated: The affliction of karma is the compositional activity of body, speech, and mind.

original: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa dgus rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa dgus rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The classification of those is also presented in nine ways:

original: ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyu dang / gnas skabs dang / sgo dang / che ba dang / phyin ci log dang / rnam grangs dang / nyes dmigs kyis so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyu dang / gnas skabs dang / sgo dang / che ba dang / phyin ci log dang / rnam grangs dang / nyes dmigs kyis so //
translated: 1. essence, 2. classification, 3. cause, 4. occasion, 5. door, 6. greatness, 7. perversion, 8. synonyms, 9. disadvantage.

original: de la ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the essence of action?

original: chos gang skye ba na mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyang skye la /
analyzed: chos gang skye ba na mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyang skye la /
translated: It is that which, arising, causes the characteristics of the formations to arise,

original: de skyes pas lus dang ngag gi mngon par 'du byed pa yang 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de skyes pas lus dang ngag gi mngon par 'du byed pa yang 'jug pa'o //
translated: and, having arisen, causes the bodily and vocal formations to occur.

original: rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of action?

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is twofold:

original: dge ba bcu dang / mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs te 'jug pa'i gang zag gi mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / las kyi lam de nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba bcu dang / mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs te 'jug pa'i gang zag gi mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / las kyi lam de nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: the classification of the person who engages in the practice of the ten good actions and the ten bad actions, and the classification of the paths of action themselves.

original: rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of action?

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
translated: It is twelvefold:

original: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang ; bdag dang / gzhan dang / gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / zang zing dang / 'jigs pa dang / gnod pa bya ba'i phyir dang / rtse zhing dga' ba dang / chos su shes pa dang /
analyzed: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang ; bdag dang / gzhan dang / gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / zang zing dang / 'jigs pa dang / gnod pa bya ba'i phyir dang / rtse zhing dga' ba dang / chos su shes pa dang /
translated: harm,üîΩplay, joy,üîΩand understanding the Dharma.

original: 'dir sa bcad gcig chad 'dug kyang ma dpe ma rnyed /
analyzed: 'dir sa bcad gcig chad 'dug kyang ma dpe ma rnyed /
translated: Here, although one section is missing, no manuscript has been found.

original: log par lta ba'i gnas skabs gang zhe na /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i gnas skabs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the occasion of wrong views?

original: rnam pa lnga ste chung ngu dang ; 'bring dang / chen po dang / byung ba dang / bag chags kyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste chung ngu dang ; 'bring dang / chen po dang / byung ba dang / bag chags kyi gnas skabs so //
translated: There are five aspects: small, medium, great, arisen, and habitual.

original: sgo gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgo gang zhe na /
translated: What is the door?

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two aspects:

original: 'bras bu 'byin pa'i sgo nas dang / gnod pa byed pa dang phan 'dogs pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin pa'i sgo nas dang / gnod pa byed pa dang phan 'dogs pa'i sgo'o //
translated: the door of producing results and the door of harming and benefiting.

original: che ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: che ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the greatness?

original: rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: rnam pa drug ste /
translated: There are six aspects:

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa @60b dang ; ngo bo nyid dang / gzhi dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs gcig tu nges pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs sel ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa @60b dang ; ngo bo nyid dang / gzhi dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs gcig tu nges pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs sel ba'o //
translated: 1) the volitional factor, 2) the non-volitional factor, 3) the essential nature, 4) the basis, 5) the determination of the adverse factor, and 6) the elimination of the adverse factor.

original: phyin ci log gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyin ci log gang zhe na /
translated: What is error?

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:

original: bya ba phyin ci log dang / 'dzin pa phyin ci log dang / dga' ba phyin ci log go //
analyzed: bya ba phyin ci log dang / 'dzin pa phyin ci log dang / dga' ba phyin ci log go //
translated: 1) error of action, 2) error of apprehension, and 3) error of delight.

original: rnam grangs gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam grangs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the synonym?

original: las byas pa dang / ma byas pa dang / bsags pa dang / ma bsags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: las byas pa dang / ma byas pa dang / bsags pa dang / ma bsags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag go //
translated: It is the action that has been done and not done, accumulated and not accumulated, etc.

original: nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the disadvantage?

original: rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun te /
translated: It is sevenfold:

original: bdag la gnod pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod pa dang / tshe 'di'i kha na ma tho ba bskyed pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba bskyed pa dang / de las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba byung ba sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: bdag la gnod pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod pa dang / tshe 'di'i kha na ma tho ba bskyed pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba bskyed pa dang / de las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba byung ba sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: 1) harm to oneself, 2) harm to others, 3) harm to both, 4) the production of demerit, 5) the production of a bad reputation, 6) the production of remorse, and 7) the production of the demerit that is the basis of remorse.

original: yid mi bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and he experiences mental dissatisfaction.

original: sred pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sred pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is craving?

original: rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is of four kinds:

original: bdag tu sred pa dang / rtag par sred pa dang / bde bar sred pa dang / gtsang bar sred pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu sred pa dang / rtag par sred pa dang / bde bar sred pa dang / gtsang bar sred pa'o //
translated: craving for self, craving for permanence, craving for pleasure, and craving for purity.

original: de la bdag tu sred pa la brten nas ni lus la chags pa dang ldan pa'i sred pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la bdag tu sred pa la brten nas ni lus la chags pa dang ldan pa'i sred pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From craving for self there arises the craving that is attached to the body.

original: rtag par sred pa la brten nas ni yang 'byung ba'i sred pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rtag par sred pa la brten nas ni yang 'byung ba'i sred pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From craving for permanence there arises the craving for continued existence.

original: bde bar sred pa la brten nas ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bde bar sred pa la brten nas ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From craving for pleasure there arises the craving that is attached to delight and passion.

original: gtsang bar sred pa la brten nas ni de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: gtsang bar sred pa la brten nas ni de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa 'byung ste /
translated: From craving for purity there arises the craving that delights in this and that.

original: sred pa rnam pa bzhi de dag las dang po ni sred pa'i bag la nyal gyi rnam pa yin la /
analyzed: sred pa rnam pa bzhi de dag las dang po ni sred pa'i bag la nyal gyi rnam pa yin la /
translated: Of these four kinds of craving, the first is the form of latent tendency of craving.

original: tha ma gsum ni sred pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i rnam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tha ma gsum ni sred pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i rnam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The last three should be understood as the forms of the fetter of craving.

original: de la lus chags pa dang ldan pa'i sred pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lus chags pa dang ldan pa'i sred pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is craving associated with attachment to a body?

original: lus la chags shing sbyor bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus la chags shing sbyor bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is attachment to a body and the practice of union.

original: yang 'byung ba'i sred pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'byung ba'i sred pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is craving for a new existence?

original: phyi ma'i lus kyi khyad par 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i lus kyi khyad par 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the desire for a particular new existence.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is craving associated with delight and attachment?

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul yid du 'ong ba thob pa rnams la yid mi bde zhing lhag par chags pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul yid du 'ong ba thob pa rnams la yid mi bde zhing lhag par chags pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the delight and attachment of one who has obtained a pleasant object, such as a visible form, and who is not satisfied.

original: de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is craving associated with a particular state?

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul yid du 'ong ba ma thob pa rnams la kun du sbyor bar 'dod pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul yid du 'ong ba ma thob pa rnams la kun du sbyor bar 'dod pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the desire to unite with a pleasant object, such as a visible form, which one has not obtained.

original: sred pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i rnam pa gsum po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sred pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i rnam pa gsum po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: These three forms of the ensnaring of craving are in brief two-fold:

original: yang 'byung ba'i sred pa la sred pa dang @61a * //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba'i sred pa la sred pa dang @61a * //
translated: craving for a new existence and craving for the enjoyment of pleasure.

original: de'i longs spyod kyi yul la sred pa'o //
analyzed: de'i longs spyod kyi yul la sred pa'o //
translated: Craving for the objects of enjoyment.

original: de la yang 'byung ba'i sred pa ni 'byung ba'i sred pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang 'byung ba'i sred pa ni 'byung ba'i sred pa yin no //
translated: Craving for becoming is craving for the origin of becoming.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa dang / de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa gnyis ni de'i longs spyod kyi yul la sred pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa dang / de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa gnyis ni de'i longs spyod kyi yul la sred pa ste /
translated: Craving for the objects of enjoyment is twofold: craving associated with the passion for pleasure and craving for the delight of this and that.

original: de yang yul thob pa dang / ma thob pa la sred pa go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang yul thob pa dang / ma thob pa la sred pa go rims bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, it is craving for the attainment and non-attainment of objects, respectively.

original: sred pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis bsdus pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ji skad bstan pa de dag ni kun nas 'byung ba'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis bsdus pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ji skad bstan pa de dag ni kun nas 'byung ba'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The truth of origination should be understood as the essential nature of the origin of the defilements and actions which are included in these four kinds of craving, as they have been explained.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis ma mo'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis yang 'byung ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yin par gsungs pa na /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis ma mo'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul gyis yang 'byung ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yin par gsungs pa na /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn stated that the truth of origin is the origin of suffering, which is karma and affliction, in terms of the characteristics of the mother.

original: ci'i phyir mdo sde'i tshul gyis lus la chags pa dang ldan pa'i sred pa kho na kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yin par gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mdo sde'i tshul gyis lus la chags pa dang ldan pa'i sred pa kho na kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yin par gsungs she na /
translated: Why did he state in the sutra system that craving possessing attachment to the body alone is the truth of origin?

original: de ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is primary.

original: 'di ltar sred pa'i bag la nyal de ni nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / las kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / sred pa'i kun nas dkris pa rnam pa gsum po yang 'byung ba'i sred pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar sred pa'i bag la nyal de ni nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / las kun nas slong bar byed pa dang / sred pa'i kun nas dkris pa rnam pa gsum po yang 'byung ba'i sred pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa dang /
translated: Thus the latent tendency of craving is the motivator of affliction, the motivator of karma, and the motivator of the three types of entanglements of craving: craving for origin, craving possessing attachment to pleasure, and craving possessing attachment to existence.

original: de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa kun nas slong ba dngos po la khyab par byed pa dang / de skye ba nas gnod pa rnam pa mang po rgyas par byed pas de ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩde ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //üîΩ'gog pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba ma lus par spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i 'gag pa dang / phung po 'gog pas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o zhes bstan pa de la /üîΩsdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba ma lus par spangs pa ni gang /

translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe complete abandonment of suffering and its origin‚Äù refers to the seeds of these two being blocked by the noble path through the process of analytical cessation.

analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe cessation of the mental afflictions‚Äù refers to the realm of nirvana that is accompanied by the remnants of the aggregates.

original: sred pa zad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sred pa zad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: phung po 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe cessation of the heaps‚Äù refers to the realm of nirvana that is not accompanied by the remnants of the aggregates.

original: 'gog pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is also called ‚Äúcessation‚Äù and ‚Äúnirvana.‚Äù

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang rab tu dbye na rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang rab tu dbye na rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, the essential nature of the truth of cessation is of twelve types when it is differentiated.

original: mtshan nyid dang / zab pa dang / brdar btags pa dang / don dam pa dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rgyan med pa dang / rgyan dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / zab pa dang / brdar btags pa dang / don dam pa dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rgyan med pa dang / rgyan dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa dang /
