translated: In the first, the applications of mindfulness, one should understand the placement of the mind on the object.

original: de'i 'og tu dmigs pa de nyid la sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par spong pa rnams kyis rtsom par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dmigs pa de nyid la sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par spong pa rnams kyis rtsom par rig par bya'o //
translated: After that, in order to stabilize the mind on that object, one should understand the effort of the right efforts.

original: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Then, in order to perfect the meditative concentration that has been attained, one should know the application of the bases of psychic power.

original: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan ma dang / gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams kyi sbyor ba'i lam yang dag par rtsom par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan ma dang / gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams kyi sbyor ba'i lam yang dag par rtsom par rig par bya'o //
translated: Then, in order to eliminate the signs of the perfection of meditative concentration and all the negative reflex actions, one should know the correct undertaking of the path of application of the faculties and the powers.

original: de la dbang po rnams kyis ni sbyor ba chung ngu yang dag par rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: de la dbang po rnams kyis ni sbyor ba chung ngu yang dag par rtsom par byed do //
translated: Therein, by means of the faculties, one undertakes the weak application;

original: stobs rnams kyis chen po'o //üîΩde'i 'og tu sbyor ba yang dag par brtsams pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyis yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs rnams kyis chen po'o // de'i 'og tu sbyor ba yang dag par brtsams pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyis yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: by means of the powers, the strong application.üîΩThen, one should know the realization of the summit of existence by means of the limbs of enlightenment, which are the correct undertaking of the application.

original: de'i 'og tu yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Then, one should know the correct realization of the summit of existence as follows:

original: sgrub pa thams cad las rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir lam gyi yan lag rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du rjes su thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa thams cad las rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir lam gyi yan lag rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du rjes su thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the limbs of the path, up to the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, are attained in succession in order to be liberated from all forms of practice.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: Here, the four establishments of mindfulness are taught by the phrase the entity that focuses on the object.

original: de ni dngos po la yongs su rtogs pa'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: de ni dngos po la yongs su rtogs pa'i lam bstan to //
translated: This teaches the path of thorough understanding of entities.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four establishments of mindfulness?

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The establishment of mindfulness of the body, the establishment of mindfulness of feeling, the establishment of mindfulness of mind, and the establishment of mindfulness of dharmas.

original: de la ci'i phyir dang po kho nar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnam par gzhag pa yongs su bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir dang po kho nar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnam par gzhag pa yongs su bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are the four establishments of mindfulness taught first?

original: rnal 'byor bas rigs yang dag par bsgrubs te sems bskyed pa'i gong du tshogs kyi lam bsgrubs nas thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par byed pa na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor bas rigs yang dag par bsgrubs te sems bskyed pa'i gong du tshogs kyi lam bsgrubs nas thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par byed pa na /
translated: The yogi/nƒ´, having correctly accomplished the lineage and generated the Thought, having accomplished the path of accumulation prior to the generation of the root of merit conducive to liberation,

original: dang po kho nar phyin ci log @89a * //
analyzed: dang po kho nar phyin ci log @89a * //
translated: first of all abandons the four errors,

original: bzhi spangs pa dang / bden pa bzhi la 'jug pa dang / lus la sogs pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnam par gzhag pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: bzhi spangs pa dang / bden pa bzhi la 'jug pa dang / lus la sogs pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnam par gzhag pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: enters the four truths, and is taught the establishment of the four foundations of mindfulness in order to be free from body, etc.

original: de la ji ltar phyin ci log bzhi spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar phyin ci log bzhi spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one abandon the four errors?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhis ni phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhis ni phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are established as the antidotes to the four errors.

original: de la lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: de la lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: Therein, the foundation of mindfulness on body is established as the antidote to the error of purity in impurity.

original: 'di ltar lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pa las mi sdug pa dang ldan pa'i dur khrod rnam pa bzhi po kha dog dang dbyibs dang reg pa dang nye bar spyad pa mi sdug pa bstan pas des de dag lan mang du yid la byed pa
analyzed: 'di ltar lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pa las mi sdug pa dang ldan pa'i dur khrod rnam pa bzhi po kha dog dang dbyibs dang reg pa dang nye bar spyad pa mi sdug pa bstan pas des de dag lan mang du yid la byed pa
translated: Thus, through cultivating the application of mindfulness of the body, one frequently brings to mind the four types of charnel grounds that possess repulsiveness: color, shape, contact and enjoyment.

original: na / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar phyin ci log pa gang yin pa de spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar phyin ci log pa gang yin pa de spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Through this teaching on repulsiveness, one abandons the error of regarding the impure as pure.

original: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni sdug bsngal la bde bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni sdug bsngal la bde bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: The application of mindfulness to feelings is presented as the antidote to the error of regarding suffering as blissful.

original: 'di ltar tshor ba dag la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing gnas pa gang cung zad ci tshor yang rung ste de dag de la sdug bsngal lo zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshor ba dag la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing gnas pa gang cung zad ci tshor yang rung ste de dag de la sdug bsngal lo zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas na /
translated: Thus, when one observes and abides in feelings, one correctly knows that whatever feelings one experiences are suffering.

original: de'i phyir / de'i sdug bsngal la bde bar phyin ci log pa gang yin pa de spong bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de'i sdug bsngal la bde bar phyin ci log pa gang yin pa de spong bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the error of pleasure in regard to pain is eliminated.

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: The application of mindfulness to the mind is established as the antidote to the error of permanence in regard to impermanence.

original: 'di ltar nges sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas nyin mo dang mtshan mo dang skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam de dag de dag 'das par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar nges sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas nyin mo dang mtshan mo dang skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam de dag de dag 'das par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the day and night, the moments, seconds, and minutes pass by because of the differentiation of the mind with attachment, etc.

original: sems rnam pa du mas rnam pa sna tshogs mang po mthong nas dmigs pa las rtag par phyin ci log pa gang yin pa de spong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems rnam pa du mas rnam pa sna tshogs mang po mthong nas dmigs pa las rtag par phyin ci log pa gang yin pa de spong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Having seen the many varieties of the mind in many ways, the error of permanence in regard to the object is eliminated.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: The application of mindfulness to the dharmas is established as the antidote to the error of self in regard to non-self.

original: 'di ltar de la bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa rnams ni yod pa la bdag med par lta ba la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos de dag ni med pa'i phyir phung po rnams la bdag tu lta bar 'gyur bas des de
analyzed: 'di ltar de la bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa rnams ni yod pa la bdag med par lta ba la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos de dag ni med pa'i phyir phung po rnams la bdag tu lta bar 'gyur bas des de
translated: Thus, since the afflictions such as the view of self exist and the virtuous Dharmas such as the view of no self do not exist, the view of self would arise in relation to the aggregates.

original: dag rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas chos la chos kyi rjes @89b su lta zhing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong na bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log pa gang yin pa de spong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas chos la chos kyi rjes @89b su lta zhing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong na bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log pa gang yin pa de spong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, when one sees the aggregates as they are in reality, one abandons the error of viewing the self in the absence of self.

original: de la ji ltar na bden pa bzhi la 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na bden pa bzhi la 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one enter the four noble truths?

original: lus kyi gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i phung po'i 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid yin pas de la yongs su brtags pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: lus kyi gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i phung po'i 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid yin pas de la yongs su brtags pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: One enters the truth of suffering by thoroughly investigating the aggregates, which have the characteristic of conditioned formations and are associated with the body‚Äôs negative tendencies.

original: tshor ba ni sred pa'i rgyu yin pas de la yongs su brtags pas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: tshor ba ni sred pa'i rgyu yin pas de la yongs su brtags pas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: Since feeling is the cause of craving, one enters into the truth of origination by thoroughly investigating it.

original: sems ni mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi yin pas de la yongs su brtags na bdag chad par dogs pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: sems ni mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi yin pas de la yongs su brtags na bdag chad par dogs pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: Since mind is the basis of attachment, one enters into the truth of cessation, which is free from the fear of the annihilation of self, by thoroughly investigating it.

original: chos ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de la yongs su brtags pas lam rmongs par byed ba'i phyir lam gyi bden pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de la yongs su brtags pas lam rmongs par byed ba'i phyir lam gyi bden pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Since phenomena are the nature of defilement and purification, one enters into the truth of the path by thoroughly investigating it, because the path is the antidote that eliminates the darkness of ignorance.

original: de la ji ltar na lus la sogs pa dang bral bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na lus la sogs pa dang bral bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one become free from body and so on?

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i dmigs pa dang / yid la byed pa thob pa ste gnyen po bsgom pa'i dus na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams dang bral bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i dmigs pa dang / yid la byed pa thob pa ste gnyen po bsgom pa'i dus na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams dang bral bar 'gyur la /
translated: When one obtains the mental contemplation that is the object of the four foundations of mindfulness and the time of cultivating the antidote, sravakas and pratyekabuddhas become free from body, feeling, mind and phenomena.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bral bar yang mi 'gyur bar mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bral bar yang mi 'gyur bar mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Bodhisattvas do not remain in nirvana, because they do not separate from samsara.üîΩAgain, there is another enumeration:

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan yang 'jig rten pa ni phal cher 'di ltar zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan yang 'jig rten pa ni phal cher 'di ltar zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Mundane beings generally engage in this way:

original: phung po rnams la phung po tsam dang chos tsam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes pas 'di ltar bdag ni lus la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: phung po rnams la phung po tsam dang chos tsam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes pas 'di ltar bdag ni lus la brten pa yin te /
translated: They do not know aggregates, etc., as they are in reality, as mere aggregates, etc. They engage in this way: I am based on the body,

original: de la brten nas tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba myong bar 'gyur ba de myong ba na chos dang chos ma yin pa dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro zhes de ltar zhugs pa yin pas de la bdag nyid
analyzed: de la brten nas tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba myong bar 'gyur ba de myong ba na chos dang chos ma yin pa dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro zhes de ltar zhugs pa yin pas de la bdag nyid
translated: and in dependence on that, I experience feelings of pleasure and pain. When I experience them, I become afflicted or purified by virtue and nonvirtue.üîΩThus, in order to eliminate their confusion about the entity of their own body,

original: kyi lus kyi dngos po la kun du rmongs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: kyi lus kyi dngos po la kun du rmongs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: the mindfulness of body is presented.

original: bdag de nyid kyi myong ba'i dngos po kun du rmongs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam par gzhag go //üîΩde dag sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa gang kho na la bdag tu 'dzin pas kun du rmongs par 'gyur ba'i bdag gi gzhi la kun du rmongs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ni @90a * //
analyzed: bdag de nyid kyi myong ba'i dngos po kun du rmongs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam par gzhag go // de dag sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa gang kho na la bdag tu 'dzin pas kun du rmongs par 'gyur ba'i bdag gi gzhi la kun du rmongs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ni @90a * //
translated: The application of mindfulness to feeling is taught in order to eliminate the confusion about the experience of that self.

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The application of mindfulness to mind is taught in order to eliminate the confusion about the basis of the self, which is the mind, thought, and consciousness that is the object of the confusion of the belief in a self.

original: sems de kho na'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po la kun du rmongs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: sems de kho na'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po la kun du rmongs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The application of mindfulness to dharmas is taught in order to eliminate the confusion about the defiled and purified states of that mind.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang gang la las byed pa dang / gang gi don du byed pa dang / gang zhig las byed pa dang / gang gis byed pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang gang la las byed pa dang / gang gi don du byed pa dang / gang zhig las byed pa dang / gang gis byed pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: There is another way of enumerating the four establishments of mindfulness: the basis on which one practices, the purpose for which one practices, the action through which one practices, and the means by which one practices.

original: de gang la las byed ce na /
analyzed: de gang la las byed ce na /
translated: On what basis does one practice?

original: lus kyis byed do //
analyzed: lus kyis byed do //
translated: One practices on the basis of the body.

original: gang gi don byed ce na /
analyzed: gang gi don byed ce na /
translated: For what purpose does one practice?

original: tshor ba'i don du byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba'i don du byed do //
translated: One practices for the sake of feeling.üîΩThrough what action does one practice?

original: gang zhig las byed ce na sems kyis byed do //
analyzed: gang zhig las byed ce na sems kyis byed do //
translated: One practices through the mind.

original: gang gis byed ce na /
analyzed: gang gis byed ce na /
translated: By what means does one practice?

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyis byed do //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyis byed do //
translated: One practices by means of virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang gang la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba dang / gang las dang / gang zhig dang / gang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang gang la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba dang / gang las dang / gang zhig dang / gang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: There is another explanation: the four foundations of mindfulness are established in order to show the following: that which is defiled or purified, that from which it is defiled or purified, that which is defiled or purified, and that by which it is defiled or purified.

original: de la gang la zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang la zhe na /
translated: What is that which is defiled or purified?

original: lus la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The body is defiled or purified.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what is it defiled or purified?

original: tshor ba dag las so //
analyzed: tshor ba dag las so //
translated: From feelings.

original: gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is defiled or purified?

original: sems so // gang gis she na /
analyzed: sems so // gang gis she na /
translated: The mind.üîΩBy what is it defiled or purified?

original: chos kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By dharmas.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bus rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bus rig par bya ste /
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness should be understood in terms of their focal object, their essential nature, their associates, their cultivation, and the result of their cultivation.

original: de la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is their focal object?

original: lus dang / tshor ba dang sems dang chos te /
analyzed: lus dang / tshor ba dang sems dang chos te /
translated: feelings, thought and dharmas.

original: de yang bdag gi gnas kyi dngos po dang bdag gi longs spyod kyi dngos po dang bdag gi dngos po dang / bdag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: de yang bdag gi gnas kyi dngos po dang bdag gi longs spyod kyi dngos po dang bdag gi dngos po dang / bdag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po yin no //
translated: Moreover, they are the basis of the self, the basis of the enjoyment of the self, the basis of the self and the basis of the defilement and purification of the self.

original: ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is their intrinsic nature?

original: shes rab dang / dran pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang / dran pa'o //
translated: It is wisdom and mindfulness.

original: grogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: grogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is their companion?

original: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: It is the mind and mental activities associated with them.

original: bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is their cultivation?

original: nang gi lus la sogs pa la lus la sos pa'i rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi lus la sogs pa la lus la sos pa'i rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar 'jog pa'o //
translated: It is the application of mindfulness to the internal body, etc.

original: bsgoms @90b pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgoms @90b pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is their result of cultivation?

original: phyin ci log bzhi spong ba dang / bden pa bzhi la 'jug pa dang / lus la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhi spong ba dang / bden pa bzhi la 'jug pa dang / lus la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of the four errors, the entry into the four truths and the detachment from the body, etc.

original: de dag kyang mdo sde las de nang dang phyi rol gyi lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag ste /üîΩgnas pa yin zhes gsungs pas bstan te /üîΩde lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos la zhes gsungs pas ni dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag kyang mdo sde las de nang dang phyi rol gyi lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag ste / gnas pa yin zhes gsungs pas bstan te / de lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos la zhes gsungs pas ni dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: feelings, the mind and phenomena.üîΩThe statement they observe the body, feelings, the mind and phenomena indicates their focal object.

original: rjes su lta dang dran pas zhes gsungs pas ni ngo bo nyid bstan to //üîΩde nyid kyis gnas skabs kyi grogs bstan to //
analyzed: rjes su lta dang dran pas zhes gsungs pas ni ngo bo nyid bstan to // de nyid kyis gnas skabs kyi grogs bstan to //
translated: The statement they observe with regard to the body and so on indicates their nature.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag ste zhes gsungs pas ni bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag ste zhes gsungs pas ni bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: The statement they abide in the close placement of mindfulness indicates their basis.

original: gnas pa yin zhes gsungs pas ni bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: gnas pa yin zhes gsungs pas ni bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: The statement they abide indicates their result.

original: de la lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos ni gang /
analyzed: de la lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos ni gang /
translated: What is the body? What is feeling? What is the mind? What are phenomena?

original: de la rjes su lta ba ni gang /
analyzed: de la rjes su lta ba ni gang /
translated: What is observation?

original: dran pa ni gang /
analyzed: dran pa ni gang /
translated: What is mindfulness?

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni gang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni gang /
translated: What is the close placement of mindfulness?

original: gnas pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is abiding?

original: lus ni rnam pa sum cu rtsa lnga yod do //
analyzed: lus ni rnam pa sum cu rtsa lnga yod do //
translated: The body is of thirty-five kinds.

original: nang gi dang / phyi rol dang / dbang pos zin pa dang / dbang pos zin pa ma yin pa dang / sems can du bgrang ba dang / sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa dang / gnas ngan len dang ldan pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pa dang ;
analyzed: nang gi dang / phyi rol dang / dbang pos zin pa dang / dbang pos zin pa ma yin pa dang / sems can du bgrang ba dang / sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa dang / gnas ngan len dang ldan pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pa dang ;
translated: Internal, external, possessed of faculties, not possessed of faculties, counted as a sentient being, not counted as a sentient being, associated with indisposition, associated with pliancy,

original: 'byung ba'i lus dang / 'byung ba las gyur ba'i lus dang / ming gi lus dang / gzugs kyi lus dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa dang / yi dags kyi yul pa dang / mi'i dang / lha'i dang /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i lus dang / 'byung ba las gyur ba'i lus dang / ming gi lus dang / gzugs kyi lus dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa dang / yi dags kyi yul pa dang / mi'i dang / lha'i dang /
translated: the body of the elements, the body of the derivative of the elements, the body of name, the body of form, the body of hell beings, the body of animals, the body of ghosts, the body of humans, the body of gods,

original: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa dang / nang gi lus dang / phyi'i lus dang / yongs su gyur ba dang / yongs su ma gyur ba dang / bud med kyi lus dang / skyes pa'i lus dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa dang / nang gi lus dang / phyi'i lus dang / yongs su gyur ba dang / yongs su ma gyur ba dang / bud med kyi lus dang / skyes pa'i lus dang /
translated: the body with consciousness, the body without consciousness, the internal body, the external body, the transformed body, the untransformed body, the female body, the male body,üîΩthe body of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, the body of the pratyekabuddhas, the body of the buddhas, the body of the bodhisattvas.

original: ma ning gi lus dang / mdza' bshes kyi lus dang / dgra bo'i lus dang / tha mal ba'i lus dang / lus ngan pa dang ; lus 'bring dang / lus bzang po dang / gzhon nu'i lus dang / lang tsho'i lus dang / rgan po'i lus te /
analyzed: ma ning gi lus dang / mdza' bshes kyi lus dang / dgra bo'i lus dang / tha mal ba'i lus dang / lus ngan pa dang ; lus 'bring dang / lus bzang po dang / gzhon nu'i lus dang / lang tsho'i lus dang / rgan po'i lus te /
translated: the body of a neuter, the body of a friend, the body of an enemy, the body of a neutral person, a bad body, a middling body, a good body, the body of a youth, the body of a young man, the body of an old man.

original: de ni re zhig lus kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig lus kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the classification of the body.

original: de la tshor ba gang zhe na /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la tshor ba gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is feeling?

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin par @91a * //üîΩtshor ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin par @91a * // tshor ba ste /
translated: It is pleasant, unpleasant, and neither unpleasant nor pleasant.

original: de dag kyang lus kyi dang / sems kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang lus kyi dang / sems kyi'o //
translated: It is bodily and mental.üîΩIt is worldly and transcendental.

original: zang zing dang bcas pa dang // zang zing med pa dang / zhen pa la brten pa dang / nges par 'byung ba la brten pa ste /
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa dang // zang zing med pa dang / zhen pa la brten pa dang / nges par 'byung ba la brten pa ste /
translated: It is based on craving and it is based on renunciation.

original: de dag ni tshor ba nyi shu rtsa gcig rnam pa dgur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni tshor ba nyi shu rtsa gcig rnam pa dgur 'gyur ro //
translated: These are the twenty-one kinds of feeling.

original: de la sems gang zhe na /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sems gang zhe na /üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: What is mind?üîΩIt is the inner organ of thought.

original: sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / kun du bsdus pa dang /üîΩrnam par g-yeng ba dang / zhum pa dang / rab tu gzung ba dang ; rgod pa dang / rgod pa ma yin pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba ma yin pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / kun du bsdus pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / zhum pa dang / rab tu gzung ba dang ; rgod pa dang / rgod pa ma yin pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba ma yin pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: a mind that is associated with attachment and a mind that is free from attachment, a mind that is associated with aversion and a mind that is free from aversion, a mind that is associated with delusion and a mind that is free from delusion, a mind that is contracted and a mind that is distracted, a mind that is depressed and a mind that is exalted, a mind that is not concentrated and a mind that is concentrated,

original: legs par bsgoms pa dang / legs par bsgoms pa ma yin pa dang / sems shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: legs par bsgoms pa dang / legs par bsgoms pa ma yin pa dang / sems shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: a mind that is not liberated and a mind that is liberated, a mind that is well cultivated and a mind that is not well cultivated, a mind that is completely liberated and a mind that is not completely liberated.

original: de dag ni sems rnam pa nyi shu yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sems rnam pa nyi shu yin no //
translated: These are the twenty types of mind.

original: de la chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the mental factors?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang 'dul ba dang / gti mug dang / gti mug 'dul ba dang / kun du bsdus pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / zhum pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang 'dul ba dang / gti mug dang / gti mug 'dul ba dang / kun du bsdus pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / zhum pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang /
translated: laxity and excitation,üîΩcalmness and the absence of calmness,üîΩproper meditative equipoise and improper meditative equipoise,

original: rgod pa dang / rgod pa ma yin pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba ma yin pa dang / legs par mnyam par bzhag pa dang / legs par mnyam par bzhag pa ma yin pa dang / lam legs par bsgoms pa dang /
analyzed: rgod pa dang / rgod pa ma yin pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba ma yin pa dang / legs par mnyam par bzhag pa dang / legs par mnyam par bzhag pa ma yin pa dang / lam legs par bsgoms pa dang /
translated: the proper cultivation of the path and the improper cultivation of the path,

original: lam legs par bsgoms pa ma yin pa dang / shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / shin tu rnam par ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: lam legs par bsgoms pa ma yin pa dang / shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / shin tu rnam par ma grol ba ste /
translated: and complete liberation and the absence of complete liberation.

original: de dag ni nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs rnam par gzhag pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi chos nyi shu yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs rnam par gzhag pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi chos nyi shu yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: These should be understood as the twenty factors that pertain to the categories of the dark side and the bright side, which are related to the process of affliction and purification.

original: de dag ni dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: These are not objects of observation.

original: de dag la rjes su lta ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag la rjes su lta ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is subsequent insight?

original: shes rab rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩlus dang / tshor ba dang / sems chos kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum ste / lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems chos kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: It is threefold wisdom:

original: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsam pa las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i shes rab gang yin pa ste /üîΩshes rab des lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems @91b dang / chos thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du yang dag pa kho nar nye bar rtogs par byed cing kun du rtogs par byed rjes su 'jug par byed rjes su rtogs par byed rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi lus la sogs pa dang rang bzhin gyi gzugs
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsam pa las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i shes rab gang yin pa ste / shes rab des lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems @91b dang / chos thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du yang dag pa kho nar nye bar rtogs par byed cing kun du rtogs par byed rjes su 'jug par byed rjes su rtogs par byed rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi lus la sogs pa dang rang bzhin gyi gzugs
translated: wisdom born of listening, wisdom born of reflection, and wisdom born of meditation.üîΩIt is the insight that fully and correctly realizes and penetrates all the aspects of the body, feelings, mind, and all things.

original: kyi lus la sogs pa la mnyam pa nyid du lta ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kyi lus la sogs pa la mnyam pa nyid du lta ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the insight that views the body, etc., as equal, whether they are in the form of reflections or in their natural form.

original: de la dran pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dran pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is mindfulness?

original: ting nge 'dzin yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i dran pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i dran pa ste /
translated: It is mindfulness that gathers and concentrates the mind.

original: des lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: des lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are the mindfulness that is applied to the body, to feelings, to thought, and to the dharmas.

original: chos gang dag gzung ba'i chos de dag kho na'i don bsam pa gang yin pa dang / gang dag bsgoms pa mngon sum du byas pa'i tshig 'bru dang don dang mngon sum du byas pa de sems kyis mi brjed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang dag gzung ba'i chos de dag kho na'i don bsam pa gang yin pa dang / gang dag bsgoms pa mngon sum du byas pa'i tshig 'bru dang don dang mngon sum du byas pa de sems kyis mi brjed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The essence of mindfulness is the recollection of the meaning of the dharmas that are to be grasped, the recollection of the words and meanings of the dharmas that are to be cultivated and actualized, and the recollection of the actualization of those dharmas.

original: de ltar rjes su lta ba'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin yang dag par sdud pa'i dran pa de ni ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su lta ba'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin yang dag par sdud pa'i dran pa de ni ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The essence of mindfulness is the wisdom that observes and the samadhi that collects.

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i gnas skabs de nyid kyis de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i grogs rnams kyang bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i gnas skabs de nyid kyis de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i grogs rnams kyang bstan pa yin te /
translated: The essence of mindfulness is taught in this way. The mind and mental factors that are associated with it are also taught by this teaching of the essence.

original: de dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa las dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa las dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: They are the foundations of mindfulness because they are associated with mindfulness.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the foundations of mindfulness?

original: bdag gi nang gi lus la sogs pa'i chos de dag legs par bzung ngam /üîΩ'on te ma bzung shes rab kyis de dang de dag la legs par brtags sam /
analyzed: bdag gi nang gi lus la sogs pa'i chos de dag legs par bzung ngam / 'on te ma bzung shes rab kyis de dang de dag la legs par brtags sam /
translated: Have I properly apprehended the phenomena of my inner body, etc.?

original: 'on te ma brtags /
analyzed: 'on te ma brtags /
translated: Or have I not? Have I properly examined them with wisdom? Or have I not?

original: rnam par grol bas de dang de dag la legs par reg par byas sam /üîΩ'on te ma byas zhes dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol bas de dang de dag la legs par reg par byas sam / 'on te ma byas zhes dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Have I properly touched them with liberation? Or have I not?

original: gzhan yang dran pa kun bsrung ba dang yul gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / dmigs pa nye bar gtod pa'i rgyu gsum po de dag gis dran pa legs par nye bar gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dran pa kun bsrung ba dang yul gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / dmigs pa nye bar gtod pa'i rgyu gsum po de dag gis dran pa legs par nye bar gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, proper establishment of mindfulness is called establishment of mindfulness through the three causes of guarding all mindfulness, being uncontaminated by objects and focusing on the object.

original: de yang las dang po pa sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na ni las la mi sdug pa'i rnam par rjes su lta //
analyzed: de yang las dang po pa sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na ni las la mi sdug pa'i rnam par rjes su lta //
translated: Furthermore, when beginners are in the context of training, they contemplate the body as ugly,

original: tshor ba la sdug bsngal ba'i rnam par rjes su lta //
analyzed: tshor ba la sdug bsngal ba'i rnam par rjes su lta //
translated: they contemplate feelings as suffering,

original: sems la mi rtag pa'i rnam par rjes su lta //
analyzed: sems la mi rtag pa'i rnam par rjes su lta //
translated: they contemplate the mind as impermanentüîΩand they contemplate phenomena as lacking an essence.

original: chos la bdag med pa'i rnam par rjes su lta zhing gnas so //üîΩde'i 'og tu yid la byed pa thob pa'i gnas skabs na ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos la de bzhin nyid kyi lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang @92a * //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i rnam par rjes su lta zhing gnas so // de'i 'og tu yid la byed pa thob pa'i gnas skabs na ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos la de bzhin nyid kyi lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang @92a * //
translated: He abides in the contemplation of the selflessness of phenomena.üîΩSubsequently, in the phase of attaining mental attention, he abides in the contemplation of the reality of body, sensation, thought and the dharmas,

original: chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
translated: in the contemplation of the reality of body, sensation, thought and the dharmas.

original: de la ji ltar nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin /
analyzed: de la ji ltar nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin /
translated: How does he abide in the contemplation of the internal body?

original: ji ltar na phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin /
translated: How does he abide in the contemplation of the external body?

original: ji ltar na nang dang phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na nang dang phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin /
translated: How does he abide in the contemplation of the internal and external body?

original: ji ltar na nang gi tshor ba dang sems dang chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na nang gi tshor ba dang sems dang chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin /
translated: How does he abide in the contemplation of internal sensation, thought and the dharmas?

original: ji ltar na phyi rol gyi tshor ba dang sems dang chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na phyi rol gyi tshor ba dang sems dang chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin /
translated: How does he abide in the contemplation of external sensation, thought and the dharmas?

original: ji ltar na nang dang phyi rol gyi tshor ba dang sems dang chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nang dang phyi rol gyi tshor ba dang sems dang chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one abide in contemplation of the internal, external, and both internal and external feelings, mind, and dharmas?

original: gang gi tshe sems can bgrang ba nang gi so sor rang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de ni nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems can bgrang ba nang gi so sor rang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de ni nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin no //
translated: When one counts sentient beings and abides in contemplation of one‚Äôs own body, that is abiding in contemplation of the internal body.

original: gang gi tshe sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i phyi rol gyi gzugs la dmigs par byed pa ni phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i phyi rol gyi gzugs la dmigs par byed pa ni phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin no //
translated: When one focuses on external forms that are not counted as sentient beings, that is abiding in contemplation of the external body.

original: gang gi tshe sems can du bgrang ba'i phyi rol gzhan gyi gzugs la dmigs par byed pa de ni nang dang phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems can du bgrang ba'i phyi rol gzhan gyi gzugs la dmigs par byed pa de ni nang dang phyi rol gyi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin no //
translated: When one focuses on the external forms of others who are counted as sentient beings, that is abiding in contemplation of the internal and external body.

analyzed: de la sems can du bgrang ba nang gi so sor rang rang gi gzugs la brten te skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / sems dang chos gang dag la dmigs par byed pa de dag ni nang gi tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa yin no // sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i phyi rol gyi gzugs la brten te skyes pa'i tshor ba dang sems dang chos gang dag yin pa de dag la dmigs par byed pa de dag ni phyi rol gyi tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams la chos kyi rjes

translated: What is the generation of aspiration not to produce unproduced evil and nonvirtuous qualities?

original: skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed pa ni gang zhe na /

analyzed: gang gi tshe sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams dang po nas mi skyed pa'i phyir spro ba skyes par byed smon lam 'debs par byed cing dang du len par mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir
translated: When one generates enthusiasm, makes aspirations, and does not accept unproduced evil and nonvirtuous qualities in order not to produce them from the beginning, that is the generation of aspiration not to produce those that have not arisen.

analyzed: de las ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang skyes pa rnams spang ba'i 'bad pa byed pa ni gang //
translated: What is the effort for the non-arising of those which have not yet arisen and for the abandonment of those which have already arisen?

original: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa ni gang zhe na /

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dngos po la dmigs te skye la /üîΩgang dag 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos pos dmigs te skyes pa de dag ni lkog tu gyur ba'i yul la dmigs pa yin /

original: de la lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir ni 'bad par byed pa yin no //

translated: He strives to prevent the arising of evil, unwholesome states that have not yet arisen and to abandon those that have already arisen, in relation to objects that are hidden.

original: mngon sum gyi yul la dmigs pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir ni brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul la dmigs pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir ni brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa yin no //
translated: He exerts himself to prevent the arising of evil, unwholesome states that have not yet arisen and to abandon those that have already arisen, in relation to manifest objects.

analyzed: kun nas dkris pa chen po ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang skyes ba rnams spang ba'i phyir ni brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa yin no //

original: gnas pa na gnang dag 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dmigs pa la skyes ba de dag ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang // skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir ni 'bad par byed pa yin no //

analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos gang dag kun du rtogs pa'i dbang dang yul gyi stobs kyis kyang skyes pa 'di lta ste //

translated: He generates zeal for the abiding of wholesome states that have already arisen, for the non-forgetting of them, for the cultivation of them, for the perfecting of the cultivation of them.üîΩHere, what is the effort for the arising of wholesome states that have not yet arisen?üîΩWhat is the effort for the abiding of wholesome states that have arisen?üîΩWhat is the effort for the non-forgetting of wholesome states that have arisen?

original: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the effort for the cultivation of wholesome states that have arisen?üîΩWhat is the effort for the perfecting of the cultivation of wholesome states that have arisen?

original: dge ba'i chos thob pa rnams mngon du bsgom pa'i phyir ni 'bad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thob pa rnams mngon du bsgom pa'i phyir ni 'bad par byed pa yin no //
translated: He makes an effort to manifest and cultivate wholesome states that have already arisen.

analyzed: bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ni brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa yin no //

analyzed: gzhan yang dge ba chung ngu dang 'bring ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ni 'bad par byed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, one exerts oneself in order to generate the wholesome dharmas that have not arisen, whether small or middling, and in order to stabilize, not forget, and perfect the cultivation of those that have arisen.

original: dge ba'i chos chen po ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / bsgom yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ni //üîΩbrtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos chen po ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / bsgom yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ni //üîΩbrtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa yin no //
translated: One exerts oneself in striving in order to generate the great wholesome dharmas that have not arisen, and in order to stabilize, not forget, and perfect the cultivation of those that have arisen.

original: de la dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa dang // skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang // mi brjod pa dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa dang // skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang // mi brjod pa dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed //
translated: In this regard, one generates enthusiasm in order to give rise to wholesome states that have not yet arisen, to maintain those that have arisen, to prevent their loss, and to cultivate their complete development.

original: 'bad par byed /
analyzed: 'bad par byed /
translated: One makes an effort.üîΩOne generates effort.üîΩOne holds the mind firmly.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa na sems rab tu 'dzin par byed pa ni gang //üîΩrab tu 'jog par byed pa ni gang zhe na //üîΩgang gi tshe dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa @96a * //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa na sems rab tu 'dzin par byed pa ni gang // rab tu 'jog par byed pa ni gang zhe na // gang gi tshe dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams gnas pa @96a * //
translated: One places the mind.

original: dang ; mi brjed pa dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed /
analyzed: dang ; mi brjed pa dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed /
translated: When one generates enthusiasm in order to give rise to wholesome states that have not yet arisen, to maintain those that have arisen, to prevent their loss, and to cultivate their complete development,

original: 'bad par byed /
analyzed: 'bad par byed /
translated: one makes an effort.üîΩOne generates effort.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed cing sems zhi gnas bsgom pa dang rtse gcig tu byed pa'i tshe nang du mngon par bsdus pa na zhum pa'am zhum du dogs par mthong pa'i tshe na rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma dang bar 'gyur ba gang yang rung bas rab tu
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed cing sems zhi gnas bsgom pa dang rtse gcig tu byed pa'i tshe nang du mngon par bsdus pa na zhum pa'am zhum du dogs par mthong pa'i tshe na rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma dang bar 'gyur ba gang yang rung bas rab tu
translated: When one is making an effort to cultivate mental stability and one pointedness, if one sees that the mind is slack or in danger of slackness, one should arouse it by means of any of the signs of inspiration.

original: 'dzin par byed cing rab tu dga' bar byed de ni sems rab tu 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed cing rab tu dga' bar byed de ni sems rab tu 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the mental application of full engagement.

original: de ltar rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus na sems rgod dam rgod du dogs par mthong ba de ni de'i tshe na sems nang du mngon par sdud par byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus na sems rgod dam rgod du dogs par mthong ba de ni de'i tshe na sems nang du mngon par sdud par byed cing /
translated: When one is fully engaged in this way and sees that the mind is excited or in danger of becoming excited, one should withdraw the mind inward and settle it in meditative serenity.

original: zhi gnas la rab tu 'jog par byed pa de ni rab tu 'jog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: zhi gnas la rab tu 'jog par byed pa de ni rab tu 'jog par byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the mental application of full placement.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi po de dag las dang po ni spang bas spong ba yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi po de dag las dang po ni spang bas spong ba yin te /
translated: Among these four right efforts, the first is the effort of elimination.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa gang yin pa de dag ni kun du mi spyad pa'i sgo nas spang bar bya ba yin pas spong pas spong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa gang yin pa de dag ni kun du mi spyad pa'i sgo nas spang bar bya ba yin pas spong pas spong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The non-arising of evil, non-virtuous dharmas is to be abandoned by not engaging in them.

original: gnyis pa ni bsdams pas yongs su spang ba yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bsdams pas yongs su spang ba yin te /
translated: The second is to be abandoned by restraining them.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa gang yin pa de dag ni bsdam par bya zhing dang du mi blang bar bya ba yin pas bsdams pas spong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa gang yin pa de dag ni bsdam par bya zhing dang du mi blang bar bya ba yin pas bsdams pas spong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of evil, non-virtuous dharmas is to be abandoned by restraining them and not consenting to them.

original: gsum pa ni bsgom pas spong ba yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni bsgom pas spong ba yin te /
translated: The third is to be abandoned by meditation.

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes ba rnams bskyed pa'i phyir dge ba'i chos rnams la kun du brten par byed cing sgom par byed na ma thob pa thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes ba rnams bskyed pa'i phyir dge ba'i chos rnams la kun du brten par byed cing sgom par byed na ma thob pa thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: In order to generate virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen, one relies on and cultivates virtuous dharmas, and thus obtains what has not been obtained.

original: thob pa yang mngon du byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa yang mngon du byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And one actualizes what has been obtained.

original: bzhi pa ni rjes su bsrung bas spong ba yin te dge ba'i chos thob cing mngon sum du byas pa dag la bag med pa spangs te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rjes su bsrung bas spong ba yin te dge ba'i chos thob cing mngon sum du byas pa dag la bag med pa spangs te /
translated: The fourth is abandonment through subsequent protection.üîΩIt is the stability of the virtues that have been obtained and actualized, through the avoidance of heedlessness and the practice of heedfulness.

original: bag yod pas brtan par byed pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i chos rnams gnas pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bag yod pas brtan par byed pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i chos rnams gnas pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because the virtues that have been obtained and actualized will be maintained, not forgotten, and their cultivation will be perfected.

original: de ni re zhig yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba rgyas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig yang dag pa'i spong ba rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba rgyas pa yin no //
translated: This is the extensive classification of the right efforts.

original: don mdor bsdu ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: don mdor bsdu ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is their synthesis?

original: nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs kyi dngos po btang ba dang blang ba'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs kyi dngos po btang ba dang blang ba'i bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: They are the perfect fulfillment of the intention to abandon and to adopt the dark and bright sides, and the perfect fulfillment of application.

original: de la bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ni 'dun pa skyed par byed ces bya bas bstan to //üîΩsbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ni @96b 'bad par byed /
analyzed: de la bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ni 'dun pa skyed par byed ces bya bas bstan to //üîΩsbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ni @96b 'bad par byed /
translated: The perfect fulfillment of intention is shown by the words ‚Äúhe generates will.‚ÄùüîΩThe perfect fulfillment of application is shown by the words ‚Äúhe strives, makes an effort, exerts his mind, and strives with his whole being.‚Äù

original: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed cing sems rab tu 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom par byed cing sems rab tu 'dzin par byed /
translated: They are diligent, and they fully focus their minds.

original: rab tu 'jog par byed ces bya ba dag gis bstan te /
analyzed: rab tu 'jog par byed ces bya ba dag gis bstan te /
translated: They are taught by the four lines beginning, ‚ÄúThey are diligent, they are mindful, they are concentrated.‚Äù

original: rnal 'byor bas bya ba ni 'di tsam du zad de spang bar bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa spang bar bya ba dang / thob par bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa thob par bya ba'i phyir dang po kho nar 'bad pas spro ba bskyed par bya ba dang /
analyzed: rnal 'byor bas bya ba ni 'di tsam du zad de spang bar bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa spang bar bya ba dang / thob par bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa thob par bya ba'i phyir dang po kho nar 'bad pas spro ba bskyed par bya ba dang /
translated: The yogi‚Äôs activities are limited to these: in order to abandon the things that are to be abandoned and to attain the things that are to be attained, he first generates enthusiasm by exerting himself.

original: kun nas dkris pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus kyis brtson 'grus rtsom par bya ba dang / bag la nyal spang bar bya ba'i phyir sems rab tu 'dzin pas dus dus su zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma dag bsgom par bya ba dang kun nas dkris pa dang bag la nyal gnyi ga spang bar bya ba'i phyir rab
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus kyis brtson 'grus rtsom par bya ba dang / bag la nyal spang bar bya ba'i phyir sems rab tu 'dzin pas dus dus su zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma dag bsgom par bya ba dang kun nas dkris pa dang bag la nyal gnyi ga spang bar bya ba'i phyir rab
translated: In order to abandon the entanglements, he applies diligence by being diligent in his diligence. In order to abandon the latent propensities, he repeatedly cultivates the signs of sustained calm, profound insight and equanimity by means of his mindfulness. And in order to abandon both the entanglements and the latent propensities, he applies himself to the practice of concentration.

original: tu 'jog par byed pas gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dge ba gang dag yin pa de dag yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: tu 'jog par byed pas gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dge ba gang dag yin pa de dag yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: Since one is established in the latter, one accomplishes the virtues that are the counteragents to the former.

original: de dag thams cad yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi po dag gis yongs su bstan pas na de ni mdor bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi po dag gis yongs su bstan pas na de ni mdor bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Since all of these are indicated by the four right efforts, this is a summary.

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi po de dag ni rtsol ba las byung ba'i lam yin pas na de'i phyir de nyid la rtsol ba'i dngos po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi po de dag ni rtsol ba las byung ba'i lam yin pas na de'i phyir de nyid la rtsol ba'i dngos po zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, since these four right efforts are the path that arises from exertion, therefore they are called the entity of exertion.

original: de tsam gyis na mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus par 'gags pa dang / gnyen po thob pa dang 'phel ba yin pas de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa la nye bar gtad pa'i sems la mtshan ma dang / gnas ngan len mi snang zhing nang du yang dag par mi skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus par 'gags pa dang / gnyen po thob pa dang 'phel ba yin pas de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa la nye bar gtad pa'i sems la mtshan ma dang / gnas ngan len mi snang zhing nang du yang dag par mi skye ba yin no //
translated: Since one stops the discordant class without exception and obtains and increases the counteragent, the signs and the negative reflex actions do not appear and are not generated internally in the mind that is directed to the object of suchness.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The four bases of supernormal powers are indicated by the entity of mental stability.

original: des ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyor bar byed pa'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: des ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyor bar byed pa'i lam bstan to //
translated: This teaches the path that perfects samƒÅdhi.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi gang zhe na /üîΩ'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi gang zhe na / 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
translated: What are the four bases of supernatural powers?

original: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
translated: The base of supernatural power that is the concentration of aspiration accompanied by the volition of striving, the base of supernatural power that is the concentration of vigor accompanied by the volition of striving, the base of supernatural power that is the concentration of mind accompanied by the volition of striving, and the base of supernatural power that is the concentration of investigation accompanied by the volition of striving.

original: de la rig pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la rig pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is knowledge?

original: de de ltar yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi po dag gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus par spangs pa dang / gnyen po thob cing @97a * //
analyzed: de de ltar yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi po dag gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus par spangs pa dang / gnyen po thob cing @97a * //
translated: When, in this way, the four genuine restraints have completely abandoned the discordant class and have attained the antidotes, and when, through the power of the four genuine restraints, the four concentrations have been attained, then the four bases of supernatural power are attained.

original: 'phel bas de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa la nye bar gtad pa'i sems la mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len mi snang zhing nang yang dag par mi skye ba na de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rdzu
analyzed: 'phel bas de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa la nye bar gtad pa'i sems la mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len mi snang zhing nang yang dag par mi skye ba na de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rdzu
translated: Through increase, the mind that is focused on the object of suchness is not sullied by signs and does not generate internal negative tendencies.üîΩüîΩAfter that, in order to perfect meditative concentration, the bodhisattva enters the meditative concentration of the peak.üîΩ

original: 'phrul gyi rkang pa la sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phrul gyi rkang pa la sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
translated: By its increase, the mind that is directed to the object of reality no longer perceives signs and the bad habit of discursiveness, and is not born internally. After that, one should know that the bases of supernatural power are applied in order to perfect the attainment of concentration.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi yang dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bus rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi yang dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bus rig par bya ste /
translated: The four bases of supernatural power should be understood in terms of object, nature, aid, cultivation, and result of cultivation.

original: de la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object?

original: ting nge 'dzin 'grub pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'grub pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: It is the activity of accomplishing concentration.

original: ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature?

original: ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: It is concentration.

original: grogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: grogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aid?

original: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: It is will, vigor, mind, and investigation, and the mind and mental activities associated with them.

original: bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is meditation?

original: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad goms par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the practice of the eight formative factors of abandonment.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /üîΩde ltar ting nge 'dzin legs par yongs su sbyang ba byas nas chos mngon par shes par bya ba gang dang gang mngon du bya bar 'dod pa de dang de la sems mngon par gtod pa de rang rang gi gnas kyi chos rnams la mngon du gyur ba'i
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na / de ltar ting nge 'dzin legs par yongs su sbyang ba byas nas chos mngon par shes par bya ba gang dang gang mngon du bya bar 'dod pa de dang de la sems mngon par gtod pa de rang rang gi gnas kyi chos rnams la mngon du gyur ba'i
translated: What is the result of meditation?üîΩHaving thus well purified concentration, he directs his mind to the realization of any of the superknowledges that he wishes to realize.

original: skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes fit for the realization of the qualities that are the bases of each of the superknowledges.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of concentration:

original: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: concentration of will, concentration of energy, concentration of mind, and concentration of investigation.

original: de la 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is concentration of will?

original: 'dun pa'i dbang du byas nas ting nge 'dzin thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i dbang du byas nas ting nge 'dzin thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is concentration obtained by the power of will.üîΩWhat is concentration of energy?

original: brtson 'grus dang sems dang dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang sems dang dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is concentration of mind?üîΩWhat is concentration of investigation?

original: brtson 'grus dang sems dang dpyod pa'i dbang du byas nas ting nge 'dzin thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang sems dang dpyod pa'i dbang du byas nas ting nge 'dzin thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the attainment of concentration through the powers of vigor, mind, and investigation.

original: yang gus par sbyor ba la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa gang yin pa de ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang gus par sbyor ba la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa gang yin pa de ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Again, the concentration of will is the touching of one-pointedness of mind based on devoted effort.

original: rgyun du sbyor ba la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: rgyun du sbyor ba la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The concentration of vigor is the touching of one-pointedness of mind based on continuous effort.

original: sngon ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: sngon ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The concentration of mind is the touching of one-pointedness of mind based on the cultivation of concentration in the past.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la brten nas sems @97b rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa gang yin pa de ni dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la brten nas sems @97b rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa gang yin pa de ni dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The concentration of investigation is the touching of one-pointedness of mind based on the discrimination of the dharmas.

original: yang 'dun pa skyed par byed pa na sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa gang yin pa de ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang 'dun pa skyed par byed pa na sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa gang yin pa de ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Again, the concentration of will is the touching of one-pointedness of mind when one generates will.

original: 'bad par byed brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa na sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin to //üîΩsems rab tu 'jog par byed pa na sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'bad par byed brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa na sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin to // sems rab tu 'jog par byed pa na sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: When one is making an effort, when one is undertaking vigor, the touching of one-pointedness of thought is the samadhi of vigor.üîΩWhen one is settling the thought, the touching of one-pointedness of thought is the samadhi of thought.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin par byed pa na sems rtse gcig pa nyid la rag pa gang yin pa de ni dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin par byed pa na sems rtse gcig pa nyid la rag pa gang yin pa de ni dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
