analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang sems pa dang btang snyoms ni thabs kyi sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Pliancy, mindfulness, introspective knowledge, volition, and equanimity are the applications of the means.

original: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad po de dag ni yan lag bzhis bsdus pa yang yin te /
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad po de dag ni yan lag bzhis bsdus pa yang yin te /
translated: These eight formative forces that facilitate relinquishment are also included within four members:

original: bsgom pa'i yan lag dang / khyad par nyon mongs pa'i yan lag dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rjes su bsrung ba rtogs pa'i yan lag dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir sdud pa'i yan lag gis so //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i yan lag dang / khyad par nyon mongs pa'i yan lag dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rjes su bsrung ba rtogs pa'i yan lag dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir sdud pa'i yan lag gis so //
translated: the member of cultivation, the member of the special thorough relinquishment, the member of the realization of the protection from the secondary mental afflictions, and the member of the collection for the purification of the secondary mental afflictions.

original: de la bsgom pa'i yan lag ni 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba ste /
analyzed: de la bsgom pa'i yan lag ni 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba ste /
translated: Among them, the member of cultivation is will and effort.

original: 'di ltar 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba gnyis la brten nas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba gnyis la brten nas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, one cultivates the bases of psychic power in dependence on both will and effort.

original: khyad par rtogs pa'i yan lag ni dang ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa ste ;
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa'i yan lag ni dang ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa ste ;
translated: The member of the special thorough relinquishment is faith and pliancy.

original: 'di ltar dad pas ni khyad par rtogs nas gong ma'i rnam par thar pa la mngon par dad par byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dad pas ni khyad par rtogs nas gong ma'i rnam par thar pa la mngon par dad par byed la /
translated: Thus, through faith, one has realized the distinctive understanding and generates manifest faith in the higher liberation.

original: shin tu sbyangs pas ni lus dang sems kyi gnas ngan len shin tu sbyong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pas ni lus dang sems kyi gnas ngan len shin tu sbyong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And through serenity, one purifies the negative propensities of body and mind.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rjes su bsrung ba rtogs pa'i yan lag ni dran pa dang / @99b shes bzhin te /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rjes su bsrung ba rtogs pa'i yan lag ni dran pa dang / @99b shes bzhin te /
translated: The branches of protection against the secondary passions are mindfulness and vigilance.

original: 'di ltar dran pas ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ma byung ba srung bar byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dran pas ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ma byung ba srung bar byed la /
translated: Thus, through mindfulness, one protects against the secondary passions of serenity and insight that have not yet arisen.

original: shes bzhin gyis ni byung ba rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bzhin gyis ni byung ba rtogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And through vigilance, one recognizes those that have arisen.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir sdud pa'i yan lag gi sems pa dang / btang snyoms te /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir sdud pa'i yan lag gi sems pa dang / btang snyoms te /
translated: The branches of concentration are intention and equanimity, because they purify the secondary passions.

original: 'di ltar sems pas ni sems zhum pa'i phyir 'dzin par byed la /üîΩbtang snyoms kyis ni rgod pa nang du sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems pas ni sems zhum pa'i phyir 'dzin par byed la /üîΩbtang snyoms kyis ni rgod pa nang du sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, through intention, one concentrates the mind that has become slack.üîΩAnd through equanimity, one concentrates the mind that has become excited.

original: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad po de dag ni nyes pa lnga spong ba'i phyir 'du byed pa yin pas de'i phyir spang ba'i 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad po de dag ni nyes pa lnga spong ba'i phyir 'du byed pa yin pas de'i phyir spang ba'i 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: These eight formative factors that facilitate relinquishment are formative factors that facilitate the relinquishment of the five faults.

original: nyes pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five faults?

original: le lo dang / gdams ngag brjed pa dang / bying ba dang rgod pa dang / bying ba dang rgod pa rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i dus na mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / bying ba dang rgod pa rab tu zhi ba'i tshe na mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: le lo dang / gdams ngag brjed pa dang / bying ba dang rgod pa dang / bying ba dang rgod pa rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i dus na mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / bying ba dang rgod pa rab tu zhi ba'i tshe na mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: Laziness, forgetting the instructions, laxity and excitement, non-application and application.

original: de dag spang ba'i phyir spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de dag spang ba'i phyir spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How are the eight formative factors that facilitate relinquishment established in order to relinquish these?

original: le lo spong ba'i phyir ni spong ba'i 'du byed bzhi rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: le lo spong ba'i phyir ni spong ba'i 'du byed bzhi rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Four formative factors that facilitate relinquishment are established in order to relinquish laziness:

original: 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: zeal, endeavour, faith and pliancy.

original: de dag kyang gnas dang de la gnas pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang gnas dang de la gnas pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu yin te /
translated: These are the basis, that which is based on it, the cause and the result.

original: 'dun pa ni rtsol ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni rtsol ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: Will is the basis of effort.

original: rtsol ba ni 'dun pa de la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsol ba ni 'dun pa de la gnas pa yin no //
translated: Effort is the basis of will.

original: dad pa ni gnas 'dun pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dad pa ni gnas 'dun pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Faith is the cause of the basis, will.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni gnas pa rtsol ba de'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni gnas pa rtsol ba de'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Relaxation is the result of the basis, effort.

original: nyes pa de'i lhag ma bzhi spang ba'i phyir ni spong ba'i 'du byed lhag ma bzhi go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: nyes pa de'i lhag ma bzhi spang ba'i phyir ni spong ba'i 'du byed lhag ma bzhi go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The remaining four formative forces that facilitate relinquishment are respectively determined for the purpose of abandoning the four remaining faults.

original: dran pa ni dmigs pa ma brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: dran pa ni dmigs pa ma brjod pa yin la /
translated: Recollection is the non-forgetting of the object.

original: shes bzhin ni dran pa ma brjed par gyur na bying ba dang rgod pa rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: shes bzhin ni dran pa ma brjed par gyur na bying ba dang rgod pa rtogs pa yin /
translated: When there is no forgetting of the object through recollection, then slackness and excitedness are recognized.

original: sems pa ni rtogs nas de dang bral ba'i phyogs mngon par 'du byed pa yin /
analyzed: sems pa ni rtogs nas de dang bral ba'i phyogs mngon par 'du byed pa yin /
translated: When they are recognized, then the formative force that is directed towards the side of their removal is volition.

original: btang snyoms ni bying ba dang rgod pa de nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba na rnal du 'jog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni bying ba dang rgod pa de nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba na rnal du 'jog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Equanimity is the state of composure when slackness and excitedness are pacified.

original: de ltar 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin snga ma gang dag yin pa dang spong ba'i 'du byed 'di dag gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te bag la nyal spangs shing ting nge 'dzin yongs su grub pa ni 'dun pa'i ting
analyzed: de ltar 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin snga ma gang dag yin pa dang spong ba'i 'du byed 'di dag gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te bag la nyal spangs shing ting nge 'dzin yongs su grub pa ni 'dun pa'i ting
translated: Thus, all of these former concentrations such as aspiration and these applications of abandoning are combined into one and are called the foot of supernatural power that is concentration with aspiration and the application of abandoning.

original: nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ba dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge @100a * //üîΩ'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ba dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge @100a * // 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The foot of supernatural power that is concentration with effort, mind, and investigation is also like this.

original: nyes pa lnga spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad bsgoms pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin la /
analyzed: nyes pa lnga spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad bsgoms pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin la /
translated: The four concentrations of aspiration, effort, mind, and investigation arise from the cause of cultivating the eight applications that abandon the five faults.

original: ting nge 'dzin bzhi po de dag nyid rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bzhi po de dag nyid rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These four concentrations should be known as the four feet of supernatural power.

original: de la ci'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya zhe na /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: Why are they called ‚Äúbases of supernatural power‚Äù?

original: dper na gang la rkang pa yod pa des 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang pha rol gnas par nus pa de bzhin du gang la nyes pa lnga spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad kyi chos de dag kyang yod la /
analyzed: dper na gang la rkang pa yod pa des 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang pha rol gnas par nus pa de bzhin du gang la nyes pa lnga spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad kyi chos de dag kyang yod la /
translated: For example, just as one who has feet can walk, turn around, and stand on a distant shore, so too, one who has these qualities of the eight formative factors that abandon the five faults,üîΩand who has the four concentrations of aspiration and so on that arise from the cause of cultivating them,

original: de dag bsgoms pa'i rgyu las byung ba 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi po de dag kyang yongs su rdzogs par yod cing de de ltar sems yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su byang ba dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: de dag bsgoms pa'i rgyu las byung ba 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi po de dag kyang yongs su rdzogs par yod cing de de ltar sems yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su byang ba dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
translated: and who has a completely pure and cleansed mind, a mind free of afflictions,

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / drang por gyur pa dang / las su rung bar gnas pa dang / mi g-yo ba thob par gyur na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams thob par bya ba dang / ldog pa dang / pha rol gnon par nus te /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / drang por gyur pa dang / las su rung bar gnas pa dang / mi g-yo ba thob par gyur na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams thob par bya ba dang / ldog pa dang / pha rol gnon par nus te /
translated: a mind free of secondary afflictions, a mind that is straight, a mind that abides in flexibility, and a mind that has attained stability, is able to obtain, turn away from, and master supramundane qualities.

original: de 'di ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos de dag gi rdzu 'phrul dam pa dang 'byor ba dam pa yin pas na /
analyzed: de 'di ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos de dag gi rdzu 'phrul dam pa dang 'byor ba dam pa yin pas na /
translated: Since these supramundane dharmas are the highest magic and the highest mastery,

original: de thob par bya ba'i gzhir gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi po de dag ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de thob par bya ba'i gzhir gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin bzhi po de dag ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
translated: these four concentrations which are the basis for attaining them are called the bases of magic.

original: de ltar rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi po de dag ni yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i lam yin pas na sems gnas pa'i dngos po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi po de dag ni yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i lam yin pas na sems gnas pa'i dngos po zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, since these four bases of magic are the path of thorough preparation, they are called the things which stabilize the mind.

original: de tsam gyis na nyon mongs pa'i dngos po bag la nyal yang dag par bcom pa dang / de'i gnyen po ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa thob pa dang / thar pa'i chad dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed zin pa dang /
analyzed: de tsam gyis na nyon mongs pa'i dngos po bag la nyal yang dag par bcom pa dang / de'i gnyen po ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa thob pa dang / thar pa'i chad dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed zin pa dang /
translated: By that alone, one should understand that the latent states of the things of affliction are thoroughly destroyed, the concentration which is their antidote is attained in perfection, and the roots of virtue which are conducive to liberation are already generated.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la sbyor ba'i lam rtsom par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la sbyor ba'i lam rtsom par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that one begins the path of preparation for the roots of virtue which are conducive to penetration.

original: de'i 'og tu dngos po bcu bzhis ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i lam bstan pa de gnyis kyi gnas skabs rgya cher ston to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dngos po bcu bzhis ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i lam bstan pa de gnyis kyi gnas skabs rgya cher ston to //
translated: The next ten topics show the path of thorough training in concentration by means of the four bases of magic powers, which are the bases for mental stability. These two sets of topics extensively show the stages of the path.

original: de dag gi bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de dag gi bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The topics are summarized in four ways:

original: sa dang / dmigs pa dang / @100b ngo bo nyid dang / de'i yan lag go /
analyzed: sa dang / dmigs pa dang / @100b ngo bo nyid dang / de'i yan lag go /
translated: the levels, the objects, the nature, and the branches.

original: de las ni bsam gtan bzhi'o //
analyzed: de las ni bsam gtan bzhi'o //
translated: The levels are the four meditative concentrations.

original: dmigs pa ni dmigs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni dmigs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The objects are the four objects of meditation.

original: ngo bo nyid ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'o //
translated: The nature is the knowledge of the four noble truths.

original: de'i yan lag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa de'i yan lag brgyad de /
analyzed: de'i yan lag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa de'i yan lag brgyad de /
translated: The branches are the eight branches of the knowledge of the four noble truths.

original: sbyor ba'i yan lag dang / rnam pa'i yan lag dang // de la re byed pa'i yan lag dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi yan lag dang / gnyen po'i yan lag dang / gnyen po'i yan lag dang / gnyen po'i gnas kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i yan lag dang / rnam pa'i yan lag dang // de la re byed pa'i yan lag dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi yan lag dang / gnyen po'i yan lag dang / gnyen po'i yan lag dang / gnyen po'i gnas kyi yan lag dang /
translated: They are the branch of preparation, the branch of aspect, the branch of reliance, the branch of countering factors, the branch of antidotes, the branch of the basis of the antidotes, the branch of the result of the antidotes, and the branch of the result of the result.

original: gnyen po'i bsgom pa las mi nyams pa'i thabs kyi yan lag ste dngos po gcig dang / bzhi dang / re re dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyen po'i bsgom pa las mi nyams pa'i thabs kyi yan lag ste dngos po gcig dang / bzhi dang / re re dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: The one is the one formless state.üîΩThe order is the order in which they are taught.

original: de la re zhig sa gang nas sems gnas pa'i sa ba'i dngos po de yod ce na /
analyzed: de la re zhig sa gang nas sems gnas pa'i sa ba'i dngos po de yod ce na /
translated: Now, if one asks, ‚ÄúIn what stage is the basis for the stability of mind found?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe basis for abiding happily in this life.‚Äù

original: sa ni bsam gtan bzhi po dag ste /
analyzed: sa ni bsam gtan bzhi po dag ste /
translated: The stage is the four absorptions.

original: de dag ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po de yod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag ni sems gnas pa'i dngos po de yod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: That is the basis for the stability of mind.

original: de ni mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi 'dod pa'i khams dang mi lcogs pa med pa dang nyer bsngogs rnams dang gzugs med pa bzhin yang sems gnas pa'i dngos po de yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi 'dod pa'i khams dang mi lcogs pa med pa dang nyer bsngogs rnams dang gzugs med pa bzhin yang sems gnas pa'i dngos po de yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is merely an illustration. One should understand that the basis for the stability of mind also exists in the desire realm, the stage of unrestricted access concentration, the preparatory stage, and the four formless states.

original: de la bsam gtan bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhat are the four absorptions?‚Äù

original: de 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtogs pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: de 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtogs pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba dang /
translated: Those who desire that attain and abide in the first absorption that possesses investigation and analysis and is free from the desire realm and is free from negative physical and mental states, and is associated with the joy and bliss that arise from that separation.

original: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin pas skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya
analyzed: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin pas skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya
translated: Those who are free from investigation and analysis and who have an inner clarity and a one-pointed mental continuum attain and abide in the second absorption that is free from investigation and analysis and is associated with the joy and bliss that arise from concentration.

original: ba dang / de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: ba dang / de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: Those who are free from attachment to joy abide in equanimity and possess mindfulness and introspection, and they experience physical bliss, which is the equanimity and mindfulness of the noble ones that is described as abiding in bliss.

original: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba dang / de bde ba spangs te snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nus pas bde @101a * //
analyzed: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba dang / de bde ba spangs te snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nus pas bde @101a * //
translated: He accomplishes and dwells in the third concentration that is free of joy.

original: pa yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He abandons pleasure, previously abandons pain, and through the disappearance of mental well-being and mental pain, he accomplishes and dwells in the fourth concentration that is utterly pure in its mindfulness and equanimity.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po'i skabs na 'dod pa dag ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po'i skabs na 'dod pa dag ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In the context of the first concentration, desire is twofold:

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dang / dngos po'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa dang / dngos po'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: afflictive desire and desire for things.

original: 'dod pa dag las dben pa zhes bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag las dben pa zhes bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Free from desire is also twofold:

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i dben pa dang / dmigs pa'i dben pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i dben pa dang / dmigs pa'i dben pa'o //
translated: free from association and free from objective support.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i rgyu las byung ba nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi dge ba'i chos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i rgyu las byung ba nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi dge ba'i chos 'di lta ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúisolated from evil, unwholesome dharmas‚Äù means that the bodhisattva is isolated from the unwholesome mental afflictions that arise from the causes of desire.

original: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / mtshon 'byin pa dang / dbyig pa 'byin pa dang / 'thab mo dang mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa dang /
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / mtshon 'byin pa dang / dbyig pa 'byin pa dang / 'thab mo dang mtshang 'dru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa dang /
translated: These unwholesome dharmas are as follows: bodily misconduct, verbal misconduct, mental misconduct, taking up a weapon, taking up a stick, fighting, quarreling, arguing,

original: g-yo byed pa dang / slu ba dang / snying rje med pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / kun 'byung ba gang yin pa dag ste /üîΩde dag spang ba'i phyir sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: g-yo byed pa dang / slu ba dang / snying rje med pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / kun 'byung ba gang yin pa dag ste / de dag spang ba'i phyir sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya'o //
translated: deceit, fraud, lack of compassion, lying, and the origin of these.üîΩTherefore, it is said that the bodhisattva is ‚Äúisolated from evil, unwholesome dharmas.‚Äù

original: de la ci'i phyir 'dod pa dag las dben pa zhes gsungs nas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir 'dod pa dag las dben pa zhes gsungs nas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes gsungs she na /
translated: Why is it said that the bodhisattva is isolated from desire and also isolated from evil, unwholesome dharmas?

original: 'dod pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dod pa dag ces gsungs la /üîΩ'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dod pa dag ces gsungs la / 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe sense objects‚Äù is stated to indicate the intrinsic identity of the sense objects.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes gsungs so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúevil, unwholesome dharmas‚Äù is stated to indicate the intrinsic identity of the danger in the sense objects.

original: de la nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: The danger in the sense objects is as follows:

original: 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes par spyod pa kun nas bslangs nas 'og tu ltung bar byed pa'i phyir sdig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes par spyod pa kun nas bslangs nas 'og tu ltung bar byed pa'i phyir sdig pa yin no //
translated: They are evil because they instigate evil conduct and cause one to fall into lower realms.

original: dge ba skye ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir mi dge ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba skye ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir mi dge ba yin no //
translated: They are unwholesome because they are not conducive to the arising of wholesome dharmas.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang / sngon bsags pa'i las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang / sngon bsags pa'i las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Another explanation is that the phrase ‚Äúthe sense objects‚Äù is stated to indicate the abandonment of the affliction of the afflictions, and the phrase ‚Äúevil, unwholesome dharmas‚Äù is stated to indicate the abandonment of the affliction of karma that was previously accumulated.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang khyim na gnas pa rnams kyi dngos po la yongs su longs spyod pa'i sgo @101b nas 'dod pa sdang bar yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang / rab tu byung ba rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas de spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes gsungs so //üîΩrnam grangs gzhan yang 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang / gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang khyim na gnas pa rnams kyi dngos po la yongs su longs spyod pa'i sgo @101b nas 'dod pa sdang bar yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang / rab tu byung ba rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas de spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes gsungs so // rnam grangs gzhan yang 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang / gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Another explanation is that the phrase ‚Äúsecluded from sense pleasures, secluded from unwholesome states‚Äù is stated in order to show that householders are attached to sense pleasures by way of fully enjoying objects, and in order to show that renunciates abandon sense pleasures by way of conceptualization.

original: 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Another explanation is that the phrase ‚Äúsecluded from sense pleasures, secluded from unwholesome states‚Äù is stated in order to show the abandonment of conceptualization of sense pleasures and in order to show the abandonment of conceptualization of malice and violence.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang phyi rol pa'i drang srong rnams 'khor ba thob pa'i rtags mngon du bstan pa'i phyir dang / de dag bsam gtan las yongs su nyams pa rnams kyi dmod pa 'dor ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang phyi rol pa'i drang srong rnams 'khor ba thob pa'i rtags mngon du bstan pa'i phyir dang / de dag bsam gtan las yongs su nyams pa rnams kyi dmod pa 'dor ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: There is another explanation: in order to demonstrate the signs of the attainment of cyclic existence by non-Buddhist sages, and in order to demonstrate the curses of those who have completely degenerated from meditative stabilization.

original: 'dod pa dag dang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dag dang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚Äúthe desire realm and non-virtuous phenomena.‚Äù

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag las skyon du mi lta ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag las skyon du mi lta ba'i phyir /
translated: It is said to possess investigation and analysis because it does not view investigation and analysis as faults.

original: 'dod pa'i gnyen pos rang gi sa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa dge ba dag dang ldan pas na rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gnyen pos rang gi sa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa dge ba dag dang ldan pas na rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said to possess investigation and analysis because it possesses virtuous investigation and analysis of its level that are antidotes to desire realm.

original: dben pa las zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa las dben pa sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa las so //
analyzed: dben pa las zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa las dben pa sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa las so //
translated: It is said to arise from separation because it arises from the mental contemplation that is the culmination of preparation that is separated from desire.

original: skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu de dang rkyen des de'i mjug thogs kho nar yang dag par skyes par bya ste /
analyzed: skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu de dang rkyen des de'i mjug thogs kho nar yang dag par skyes par bya ste /
translated: The term arisen means that it is produced immediately after that cause and condition.

original: de'i phyir dben pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dben pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called arisen from seclusion.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba can zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang re ba'i don thob cing dga' ba la skyon du mi lta ba'i phyir dang gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral zhing sems dang lus las su rung ba rgya chen po dang ldan pas na dga'
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba can zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang re ba'i don thob cing dga' ba la skyon du mi lta ba'i phyir dang gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral zhing sems dang lus las su rung ba rgya chen po dang ldan pas na dga'
translated: It is accompanied by joy and pleasure because it is accompanied by joy that does not view the faults of obtaining the object that is desired and hoped for, and it is accompanied by pleasure that is vast and pliable in mind and body, free from all depravity.

original: ba dang bde ba can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba dang bde ba can zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called accompanied by joy and pleasure.

original: bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la yang dag par nye par gtod pa dang dran pa rtse gcig tu 'dod pa'i phyir bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la yang dag par nye par gtod pa dang dran pa rtse gcig tu 'dod pa'i phyir bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called meditation because it is the one-pointedness of mind that is focused on an object of meditation.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni dang po'i 'dod pa'i khams nas bskyod pa'i go rims bzhin du bgrang ba'i phyir dang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni dang po'i 'dod pa'i khams nas bskyod pa'i go rims bzhin du bgrang ba'i phyir dang po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called first because it is counted in order, beginning with the first stage of movement out of the desire realm.

original: bsgrubs te zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bsgrubs te zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgnas so zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba @102a * //üîΩlan mang du bsgrubs pas ci 'dod pa bzhin thob pa dang dka' ba med par thob pa dang tshegs med par thob pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi snyoms par 'jug pa des mtshan mo dang nyin mo dang nyin mtshan bdun gyi bar ram /üîΩji srid kyi bar du 'da' bar byed pas na gnas so zhes bya ba gsungs pas so //
analyzed: bsgrubs te zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bsgrubs te zhes bya ba'o // gnas so zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba @102a * // lan mang du bsgrubs pas ci 'dod pa bzhin thob pa dang dka' ba med par thob pa dang tshegs med par thob pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi snyoms par 'jug pa des mtshan mo dang nyin mo dang nyin mtshan bdun gyi bar ram / ji srid kyi bar du 'da' bar byed pas na gnas so zhes bya ba gsungs pas so //
translated: Since having accomplished is the result of the culmination of practice, it is called having accomplished.

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma dag las sems rnam par bzlog nas rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma dag la legs par gtod cing /üîΩdmigs pa mi rtag par dpyod pa las rnam par phral te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma dag las sems rnam par bzlog nas rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma dag la legs par gtod cing / dmigs pa mi rtag par dpyod pa las rnam par phral te /
translated: One should turn the mind away from the signs of concentration that involve thought and discernment, and properly direct it to the signs of concentration that are free of thought and discernment.üîΩ One should also turn the mind away from the contemplation of impermanence and direct it to the contemplation of stability.

original: dmigs pa la brtan par dpyod pa la dang gcig gis sems zhi ba dang dang bar 'jug par byed cing rnam par 'jog par byed pas na /
analyzed: dmigs pa la brtan par dpyod pa la dang gcig gis sems zhi ba dang dang bar 'jug par byed cing rnam par 'jog par byed pas na /
translated: By doing so, one's mind will enter into and abide in a state of peace and clarity.

original: de'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, free of thought and discernment, inwardly clear.

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas zhes bya bas ni de bsgom pa goms par bya ba'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de nyid la rtog pa dang dpyod pas bar du gcod pa'i skabs su chad pa'i gnas skabs las yang dag par
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas zhes bya bas ni de bsgom pa goms par bya ba'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de nyid la rtog pa dang dpyod pas bar du gcod pa'i skabs su chad pa'i gnas skabs las yang dag par
translated: The phrase with a one-pointed mind indicates that in order to cultivate that concentration free of thought and discernment, one should repeatedly turn the mind away from the states of thought and discernment that interrupt it and direct it to the state of concentration free of thought and discernment.

original: 'das te / bar du gcod pa med pa dang skabs su 'chad pa med pa'i gnas skabs thob pas na de'i phyir rgyud gcig tu gyur pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'das te / bar du gcod pa med pa dang skabs su 'chad pa med pa'i gnas skabs thob pas na de'i phyir rgyud gcig tu gyur pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Having attained a state that is uninterrupted and without a break, therefore, it is said, having become a single continuum.

original: rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du spang ba'i phyir rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du spang ba'i phyir rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called without applied thought and sustained thought because applied thought and sustained thought are completely abandoned in every way.

original: ting nge 'dzin las zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin las so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin las so //
translated: From meditative absorption means from the meditative absorption that is the culmination of practice.

original: skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu de dang rkyen des de'i mjug thogs kho nar yang dag par skyes pa la bya ste /
analyzed: skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu de dang rkyen des de'i mjug thogs kho nar yang dag par skyes pa la bya ste /
translated: It is called arisen because it is arisen immediately after that, by that cause and by that condition.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, arisen from meditative absorption.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is accompanied by enjoyment and ease because it is accompanied by enjoyment and ease.

original: 'dod pa dang bde ba'i don thob cing dga' ba la skyon du mi lta ba yang dag par rab tu dga' ba dang ldan zhing yid bde ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / bsam @102b gtan dang po'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas de'i gnyen po sems dang lus shin tu sbyangs shing las su rung ba'i bde ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dga' ba dang bde ba can zhes bya'oüîΩ// bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang bde ba'i don thob cing dga' ba la skyon du mi lta ba yang dag par rab tu dga' ba dang ldan zhing yid bde ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / bsam @102b gtan dang po'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas de'i gnyen po sems dang lus shin tu sbyangs shing las su rung ba'i bde ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dga' ba dang bde ba can zhes bya'o // bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is called ‚Äúthe stage of the sphere of infinite space‚Äù because it is the sphere of the meditative absorption of infinite space.üîΩIt is called ‚Äúthe stage of the sphere of infinite consciousness‚Äù because it is the sphere of the meditative absorption of infinite consciousness.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du bgrangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlhag ma thams cad ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du bgrangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlhag ma thams cad ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúthe stage of the sphere of infinite nothingness‚Äù because it is the sphere of the meditative absorption of infinite nothingness.üîΩIt is called ‚Äúthe stage of the sphere of neither perception nor nonperception‚Äù because it is the sphere of the meditative absorption of neither perception nor nonperception.üîΩIt is called ‚Äúthe stage of the cessation of perception and feeling‚Äù because it is the stage of the meditative absorption of the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i gnas skabs nas de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i mtshan ma dag la skyon du lta ba'i phyir te ;
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i gnas skabs nas de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i mtshan ma dag la skyon du lta ba'i phyir te ;
translated: From the time of the third meditative absorption, he is free from the attachment of joy. This is because he views the signs of joy as faults.

original: de'i phyir de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúhe is free from the attachment of joy.‚Äù

original: btang snyoms la gnas shing zhes bya ba ni dga' ba med pa bsam gtan gsum pa la sems gtod par byed pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: btang snyoms la gnas shing zhes bya ba ni dga' ba med pa bsam gtan gsum pa la sems gtod par byed pa de'i tshe na /
translated: He is mindful and discerning. At the time when he is directing his mind to the third meditative absorption, which is free from joy,

original: de'i sems kun du 'khrug par byed pa'i skyon rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de'i sems kun du 'khrug par byed pa'i skyon rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: there are two faults that disturb his mind.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang da ltar gyi dga' ba dag dang bral bas na de'i phyir btang snyoms la gnas shing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang da ltar gyi dga' ba dag dang bral bas na de'i phyir btang snyoms la gnas shing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Since the second meditative absorption is free from investigation, analysis, and the joy of the present moment, therefore, it is said, ‚Äúhe is mindful and discerning.‚Äù

original: sems kun du 'khrug par byed pa'i chos de gnyis ni sems rgyun du btang snyoms su gzhag pa la gegs byed pa yin pas na sems kun du 'khrug par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems kun du 'khrug par byed pa'i chos de gnyis ni sems rgyun du btang snyoms su gzhag pa la gegs byed pa yin pas na sems kun du 'khrug par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These two dharmas cause the mind to be agitated. Since they obstruct the mind's continuous abiding in equanimity, they are called agitators of the mind.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po la ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa yod pas des na rgyun du btang snyoms la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po la ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa yod pas des na rgyun du btang snyoms la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the first meditation, there is investigation and analysis. Therefore, the mind does not continuously enter equanimity.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la ni dga' ba yod pas des na der yang rgyun du btang snyoms la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la ni dga' ba yod pas des na der yang rgyun du btang snyoms la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In the second meditation, there is joy. Therefore, the mind also does not continuously enter equanimity there.

original: de lta bas na bsam gtan dang po dang bsam gtan gnyis pa de dag la btang snyoms shas cher med pas /
analyzed: de lta bas na bsam gtan dang po dang bsam gtan gnyis pa de dag la btang snyoms shas cher med pas /

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te zhes bya bas ni btang snyoms la gnas pa na ji lta ji ltar dga' ba dang ldan pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pa de dag kun 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de lta de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag ste

original: pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pa de dag kun du 'byung bar byed na myur ba myur ba kho nar de dag la shes rab kyis so sor rtogs par byed legs par kho nar rab tu shes par byed cing 'byung ngo cog dang du mi len par spong

original: de ltar 'og ma dag la bde ba dang btang snyoms pa dang gong ma dag la bde ba med pa'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa 'di ni de dag gi gnas yin pas na 'phags pa rnams kyang de la dmigs te gnas pa'i gang zag yin pa de ni
