translated: Since the third absorption is the abode of those beings who possess pleasure and equanimity below and those who possess the absence of pleasure above, aryas focus on it and abide there.üîΩThe third absorption is called the abode of those who possess pleasure and equanimity because it is the abode of those beings who possess pleasure and equanimity below the third absorption.üîΩThe third absorption is called the abode of those who possess the absence of pleasure because it is the abode of those beings who possess the absence of pleasure above the third absorption.

original: dbang du mdzad nas gang des dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod de /
analyzed: dbang du mdzad nas gang des dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod de /
translated: The third absorption is called the abode of those who possess mindfulness and equanimity because it is the abode of aryas.

original: 'phags pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams so //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams so //
translated: Aryas are buddhas and the sriivakas of buddhas.üîΩThe third absorption is called the abode of those who possess mindfulness and the absence of pleasure because it is the abode of those beings who possess the absence of pleasure above the third absorption.

original: dga' ba med pa zhes bya ba de ltar btang snyoms la gnas te des de'i tshe dran pa dang shes bzhin dang kun du brten zhing goms par byas /
analyzed: dga' ba med pa zhes bya ba de ltar btang snyoms la gnas te des de'i tshe dran pa dang shes bzhin dang kun du brten zhing goms par byas /
translated: The third absorption is called the abode of those who possess mindfulness and equanimity because it is the abode of those beings who possess pleasure and equanimity below the third absorption.

original: lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus dga' ba dang ldan pa'i tshor ba sems dga' bar byed pa de spong bar byed cing dga' ba'i gnyen po dga' ba med pa zhi ba dang rab tu zhi ba'i tshor ba sems pa skye bar 'gyur bas na de'i phyir dga' ba
analyzed: lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus dga' ba dang ldan pa'i tshor ba sems dga' bar byed pa de spong bar byed cing dga' ba'i gnyen po dga' ba med pa zhi ba dang rab tu zhi ba'i tshor ba sems pa skye bar 'gyur bas na de'i phyir dga' ba
translated: The cause of frequent practice is the feeling of joy that delights the mind. Since that is abandoned, the antidote to joy, the feeling of equanimity that is free of joy, peaceful and completely pacified, arises in the mind.üîΩ

original: med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The cause of repeated practice is the feeling of joy that delights the mind. Since that is abandoned and the antidote to joy, the feeling of equanimity that is peaceful and completely pacified, is generated, therefore it is said to be ‚Äúwithout joy.‚Äù

original: bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The third absorption is accomplished and abides.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i skabs nas de bde ba yang spangs te zhes bya ba'i gnyen po rigs 'dra ba'i phyir spong ba'i gnyen po ma bstan @103b par de'i gnyen pos byas pa bde ba spangs pa gang yin pa de nyid bstan te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i skabs nas de bde ba yang spangs te zhes bya ba'i gnyen po rigs 'dra ba'i phyir spong ba'i gnyen po ma bstan @103b par de'i gnyen pos byas pa bde ba spangs pa gang yin pa de nyid bstan te /
translated: The context of the fourth absorption is the same as before. Since the antidote to pleasure is similar to the previous one, the antidote of abandonment is not taught. The antidote to that is taught as the abandonment of pleasure.

original: de'i gnyen po yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the antidote to that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin no //
translated: It is equanimity, mindfulness, and introspection.

original: de la brten zhing goms par byas lan mang du byas pas bsam gtan gsum pa'i las bskyed cing bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa ba'i bde ba gang yin pa de spong bar byed pas na de'i phyir de bde ba yang spangs te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de la brten zhing goms par byas lan mang du byas pas bsam gtan gsum pa'i las bskyed cing bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa ba'i bde ba gang yin pa de spong bar byed pas na de'i phyir de bde ba yang spangs te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Because of that, one generates the karma of the third concentration, and because one abandons the pleasure of the third concentration, therefore it is said, ‚Äúhaving abandoned pleasure.‚Äù

original: snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nub pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nub pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of previously abandoning suffering and because of the subsiding of mental pleasure and mental pain,

original: de'i tshe na bsam gtan pa des bde ba dang sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'das pa rjes su thob pa des sngon spangs pa gang yin pa dang / da ltar spong bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus pas na /
analyzed: de'i tshe na bsam gtan pa des bde ba dang sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'das pa rjes su thob pa des sngon spangs pa gang yin pa dang / da ltar spong bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus pas na /
translated: at that time, the meditator obtains the transcendence of pleasure and pain. Because of combining that which was previously abandoned and that which is presently abandoned,

original: de'i phyir snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nub pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba yang nub pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: therefore it is said, ‚Äúbecause of previously abandoning suffering and because of the subsiding of mental pleasure and mental pain.‚Äù

original: de la bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni bde ba spangs so //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni bde ba spangs so //
translated: When one enters the fourth meditation, one abandons pleasure.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni sdug bsngal spangs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni sdug bsngal spangs so //
translated: When one enters the second meditation, one abandons suffering.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni yid bde ba nub po //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni yid bde ba nub po //
translated: When one enters the third meditation, mental satisfaction disappears.

original: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni yid mi bde ba nub po //üîΩbde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni des re zhig bde ba dang sdug bsngal spang ba'i phyir de la lhag ma'i tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na ni yid mi bde ba nub po // bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni des re zhig bde ba dang sdug bsngal spang ba'i phyir de la lhag ma'i tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: When one enters the first meditation, displeasure disappears.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa nyi tshe yod pas na de'i phyir bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa nyi tshe yod pas na de'i phyir bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúneither displeasure nor pleasure,‚Äù this means that since one has already abandoned both pleasure and displeasure, only the neutral feeling remains.

original: btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni des de'i tshe na bsam gtan dang po yan chad kyi sa 'og ma'i skyon 'di lta ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni des de'i tshe na bsam gtan dang po yan chad kyi sa 'og ma'i skyon 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúPurity of equanimity and mindfulness‚Äù means that at that time, the faults of the lower stages up to and including the first meditative concentration are abandoned.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs dbyung ba thams cad spangs par gyur cing /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs dbyung ba thams cad spangs par gyur cing /
translated: All investigation, analysis, joy, inhalation, and exhalation are abandoned.

original: de dag spangs pa'i phyir de la btang snyoms dang dran pa gang yod pa de yongs su dag pa dang yongs su byang bar 'gyur te /üîΩdes na bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs pa de'i sems de mi g-yo bar gnas shing g-yo ba thams cad dang bral bas na de'i phyir btang snyoms @104a * //
analyzed: de dag spangs pa'i phyir de la btang snyoms dang dran pa gang yod pa de yongs su dag pa dang yongs su byang bar 'gyur te / des na bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs pa de'i sems de mi g-yo bar gnas shing g-yo ba thams cad dang bral bas na de'i phyir btang snyoms @104a * //
translated: Because they are abandoned, the equanimity and mindfulness that exist there are pure and clear.

original: dang dran pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dang dran pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the mind of one who has entered the fourth meditative concentration remains unmoving and free from all movement. For that reason, it is said that ‚Äúthere is purity of equanimity and mindfulness.‚Äù

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving accomplished the fourth meditative concentration, he remains in it‚Äù should be understood as above.

original: bsam gtan bzhi po de dag ni rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po de dag ni rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /
translated: These four meditations should be understood in four ways:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ; rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ; rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par dag pas so //
translated: by defilement, by purification, by definition, and by complete clearing.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pas ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pas ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should they be understood by defilement?

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhi po sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhi po sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa ste /
translated: The four indeterminate roots are craving, view, pride, and ignorance.

original: sred pas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: sred pas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: By craving, there is defilement by the defilement of craving.

original: lta bas ni lta ba'i shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: lta bas ni lta ba'i shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: By view, there is defilement by the meditation of one who is dominated by views.

original: nga rgyal gyis ni nga rgyal gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis ni nga rgyal gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: By pride, there is defilement by the meditation of one who is dominated by pride.

original: ma rig pas ni the tshom gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan nyid kyis nyon mongs te /
analyzed: ma rig pas ni the tshom gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan nyid kyis nyon mongs te /
translated: By ignorance, there is defilement by the meditation of one who is dominated by doubt.

original: de ltar sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dag la gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams byung ba na de'i phyir des ni kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dag la gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams byung ba na de'i phyir des ni kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, when the defilements of the mind occur in the realm of form, they are the defilements and subsidiary defilements of that realm.

original: rnam par byang bas ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par byang bas ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand purification?

original: dag pa'i bsam gtan ni dge ba'i phyir rnam par byang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dag pa'i bsam gtan ni dge ba'i phyir rnam par byang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Pure meditative concentration is called purification because it is wholesome.

original: de'i phyir des ni rnam par byang ba bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir des ni rnam par byang ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is taught that purification is meditative concentration.

original: rnam par gzhag pas ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pas ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the classification of meditative concentration?

original: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is fourfold:

original: grangs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / yan lag rnam par gzhag pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / tshad rnam par gzhag pa dang / ming du gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: grangs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / yan lag rnam par gzhag pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / tshad rnam par gzhag pa dang / ming du gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the classification of number, the classification of adverse elements, the classification of its members, the classification of meditative attainment, the classification of its measure and the classification of its nominal designation.üîΩThe classification of number refers to the four meditative concentrations.

original: de la grangs rnam par gzhag pa ni ci'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi po kho nar zad de ches mang ba yang ma yin la ches nyung ba yang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la grangs rnam par gzhag pa ni ci'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi po kho nar zad de ches mang ba yang ma yin la ches nyung ba yang ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are there only four meditations?

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal las shin tu 'das shing yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal las shin tu 'das shing yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the culmination of the transcendence of pleasure and pain.

original: 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po nas mthar gyis bzhi pa'i bar du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal las shin tu 'das shing yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po nas mthar gyis bzhi pa'i bar du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal las shin tu 'das shing yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first meditation is the culmination of the transcendence of pain; the second, of the transcendence of pleasure; the third, of the transcendence of the desire for pleasure and the desire for the absence of pain; and the fourth, of the transcendence of the desire for the absence of pain and the desire for the absence of pleasure.üîΩWhat is the classification of the adverse elements?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par gzhag pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na lnga ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par gzhag pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na lnga ste /
translated: The adverse elements of the first meditation are the five:

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems @104b dang ; rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems @104b dang ; rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: the idea of desire, the idea of malice, the idea of violence, dissatisfaction, and immorality.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
translated: What are the adverse elements of the second meditation?

original: de yang lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang lnga ste /
translated: They are also five:

original: bsam gtan dang po'i 'dod chags dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / rgod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i 'dod chags dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / rgod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: 1. the attachment to the first meditation, 2. initial inquiry and investigation, 3. suffering, 4. agitation, 5. the nonperfection of concentration.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the adverse factor of the third meditation?

original: bzhi ste / bsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'dod chags dang / yid bde ba dang / dga' ba dang / ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi ste / bsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'dod chags dang / yid bde ba dang / dga' ba dang / ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: It is fivefold: 1. the attachment to the second meditation, 2. the joy, 3. the pleasure, 4. the nonperfection of concentration.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the adverse factor of the fourth meditation?

original: de yang lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang lnga ste /
translated: It is fourfold:

original: dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang / bde ba la sogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang / bde ba la sogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: 1. inbreathing and outbreathing, 2. the attachment to the third meditation, 3. the pleasure, 4. the nonperfection of concentration.üîΩWhat is the definition of the members?

original: yan lag rnam par gzhag pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i yan lag du zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag rnam par gzhag pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i yan lag du zhe na /
translated: How many members does the first meditation have?

original: lnga ste / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: lnga ste / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: It has five members: 1. initial inquiry, 2. investigation, 3. joy, 4. pleasure, 5. the mind being unified.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i yan lag du zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i yan lag du zhe na /
translated: How many branches does the second absorption have?

original: bzhi ste / nang yongs su dang ba dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: bzhi ste / nang yongs su dang ba dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: It has four: inner clarity, joy, bliss, and singlepointed mind.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i yan lag du zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i yan lag du zhe na /
translated: How many branches does the third absorption have?

original: de yang lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang lnga ste /
translated: It has five:

original: dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / btang snyoms dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / btang snyoms dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: mindfulness, introspection, equanimity, bliss, and singlepointed mind.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i yan lag du zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i yan lag du zhe na /
translated: How many branches does the fourth absorption have?

original: de yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang bzhi ste /
translated: It has four:

original: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: pure equanimity, pure mindfulness, neither pleasure nor pain, and singlepointed mind.

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi po de dag yan lag lnga pa dang bzhi par rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi po de dag yan lag lnga pa dang bzhi par rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are the four absorptions posited as having five branches and four branches?

original: gnas pa'i rten dang gnas pa la phan pa dang gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rten dang gnas pa la phan pa dang gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the basis of abiding, they benefit abiding, and they are the nature of abiding.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po'i yan lag lnga las rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa'i yan lag bzhi las nang yongs su dang ba dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i yan lag lnga las dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po'i yan lag lnga las rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa'i yan lag bzhi las nang yongs su dang ba dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i yan lag lnga las dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang /
translated: Among the five branches of the third meditation, mindfulness, introspection, and

original: btang snyoms dang / @105a * //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang / @105a * //
translated: equanimity are the branches of initial application.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i yan lag bzhi las btang snyoms dag pa dang dran pa yongs su dag pa ni bsam gtan bzhi po rang rang gi gnas pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i yan lag bzhi las btang snyoms dag pa dang dran pa yongs su dag pa ni bsam gtan bzhi po rang rang gi gnas pa'i rten yin no //
translated: Among the four branches of the fourth meditation, pure equanimity and pure mindfulness are the branches of initial application.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i dga' ba dang bde ba dang / gnyis pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba dang / gsum pa'i bde ba dang / bzhi pa'i sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni rang rang gi gnas pa la phan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i dga' ba dang bde ba dang / gnyis pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba dang / gsum pa'i bde ba dang / bzhi pa'i sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni rang rang gi gnas pa la phan pa yin no //
translated: The joy and pleasure of the first meditation, the joy and pleasure of the second meditation, the pleasure of the third meditation, and the neither pleasure nor suffering of the fourth meditation are the benefits of the respective meditations.

original: bsam gtan bzhi par sems rtse gcig pa bzhi ni rang rang gi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi par sems rtse gcig pa bzhi ni rang rang gi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The four one-pointednesses of the fourth meditation should be understood as the natures of the respective meditations.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang dmigs pa yid la byed pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su spyod pa dang / dmigs pa la mi 'phro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang dmigs pa yid la byed pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su spyod pa dang / dmigs pa la mi 'phro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is another explanation: because it is the mental attention to the object, the mastery of the object, and the non-diffusion of the object.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang phan 'dogs pa'i rten dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi rten dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang phan 'dogs pa'i rten dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi rten dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is another explanation: because it is the basis of benefit, the basis of superior mind, and the basis of superior wisdom.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can mi gnas pa rnam pa gsum po nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i gnas pa dang / kun du rmongs pa'i gnas pa'i gnyen po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can mi gnas pa rnam pa gsum po nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i gnas pa dang / kun du rmongs pa'i gnas pa'i gnyen po'i phyir ro //
translated: There is another explanation: because it is the antidote to the three kinds of non-abiding addictions which are adverse to the addictions, to suffering, and to confusion.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang bsam gtan pa rnams kyi 'dod pa la longs spyod pa dang chos mthun pa yin par lta bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang bsam gtan pa rnams kyi 'dod pa la longs spyod pa dang chos mthun pa yin par lta bar byed do //
translated: There is another explanation: because it is similar to the enjoyment of the objects of desire for those who are absorbed in meditation.

original: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi yang dag par bya ba ni gsum po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi yang dag par bya ba ni gsum po 'di dag yin te /
translated: For those who enjoy the objects of desire, there are three things to be done:

original: longs spyod legs par yongs su tshol ba dang / yongs su btsal ba rnams la legs par longs spyod pa dang / de la dbang sgyur ba la rang dbang yod pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod legs par yongs su tshol ba dang / yongs su btsal ba rnams la legs par longs spyod pa dang / de la dbang sgyur ba la rang dbang yod pa'o //
translated: 1. the proper search for enjoyments; 2. the proper enjoyment of what is searched out; 3. the mastery of that enjoyment.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan pa rnams kyi yan lag kyang legs par bya ba gsum la brten nas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan pa rnams kyi yan lag kyang legs par bya ba gsum la brten nas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Similarly, the limbs of the contemplatives are established on the basis of three good actions.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang bsam gtan pa rnams kyi yan lag ni dka' thub drag po'i gnyen po rnam pa gsum du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang bsam gtan pa rnams kyi yan lag ni dka' thub drag po'i gnyen po rnam pa gsum du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Another enumeration: the limbs of the contemplatives are established as three kinds of antidotes to the three kinds of severe austerities.

original: gnyen po ma yin pa'i gnyen po dang / lus dang sems la gnod pa'i gnyen po dang / sems phyi rol du 'phro ba nye bar ma zhi ba'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: gnyen po ma yin pa'i gnyen po dang / lus dang sems la gnod pa'i gnyen po dang / sems phyi rol du 'phro ba nye bar ma zhi ba'i gnyen po'o //
translated: 1. the antidote to the non-antidote; 2. the antidote to the harm to body and mind; 3. the antidote to the non-pacification of the mind scattering externally.

original: rnam grangs de dag la bsam gtan bzhi po dang / ngag gi yan lag lnga dang bzhi dum bu gsum gsum du bcad pa'i tshul ni snga ma @105b bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs de dag la bsam gtan bzhi po dang / ngag gi yan lag lnga dang bzhi dum bu gsum gsum du bcad pa'i tshul ni snga ma @105b bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: In these enumerations, the four contemplations and the five and four limbs of speech are to be understood as divided into three sections, as before.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni yid la byed pa bdun gyis bsam gtan rnams la snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni yid la byed pa bdun gyis bsam gtan rnams la snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: The meditative attainment of the absorptions is by seven attentions.

original: mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa dang / mos pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa dang / rab tu dben pa'i yid la byed pa dang / dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa dang / dga' ba sdud pa'i yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa dang / mos pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa dang / rab tu dben pa'i yid la byed pa dang / dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa dang / dga' ba sdud pa'i yid la byed pa dang /
translated: They are attention that is knowledge of the characteristics, attention that arises from belief, attention that is isolated, attention that is investigation, attention that is the gathering of joy,

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa dag gis so //
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa dag gis so //
translated: attention that is the culmination of practice and attention that is the result of the culmination of practice.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po la yid la byed pa bdun gyis ji ltar snyoms par 'jug ce na /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po la yid la byed pa bdun gyis ji ltar snyoms par 'jug ce na /
translated: How does one enter meditative attainment by seven attentions in the first absorption?

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pa gang gis 'dod pa rnams la rags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bsam gtan dang po la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du so sor rig par byed pa de ni de'i mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pa gang gis 'dod pa rnams la rags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bsam gtan dang po la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du so sor rig par byed pa de ni de'i mtshan nyid so sor rig pa'i yid la byed pa yin te /
translated: The attention of the stage of meditative equipoise that discerns the characteristics of the coarseness of the realm of desire and the calmness of the first meditative stabilization is the attention of discernment of the characteristics.

original: de ni thob pa dang bcas pa dang 'dres pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni thob pa dang bcas pa dang 'dres pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this attention is accompanied by the attainment of the first meditative stabilization and is mixed with the realm of desire.

original: des de ltar 'dod pa rnams la rags pa'i mtshan nyid dang bsam gtan dang po la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du so sor rig nas /
analyzed: des de ltar 'dod pa rnams la rags pa'i mtshan nyid dang bsam gtan dang po la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du so sor rig nas /
translated: Having thus discerned the characteristics of the coarseness of the realm of desire and the calmness of the first meditative stabilization,üîΩhe transcends the investigation of the first meditative stabilization and the hearing and reflection that are the characteristics of the coarseness of the realm of desire and the calmness of the first meditative stabilization.

original: bsam gtan dang po la yongs su tshol ba dang rags pa zhi ba'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin gyi thos pa dang bsam pa las yang dag par 'das nas gcig tu bsgom pa'i rnam pas mos par byed cing /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la yongs su tshol ba dang rags pa zhi ba'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin gyi thos pa dang bsam pa las yang dag par 'das nas gcig tu bsgom pa'i rnam pas mos par byed cing /
translated: He cultivates the first meditative stabilization by means of the aspect of cultivation alone.

original: mtshan ma de nyid la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed de /
analyzed: mtshan ma de nyid la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed de /
translated: He cultivates serenity and insight that have that very sign as their object.

original: sgom par byed pas na ji ltar yongs su tshol ba dang rags pa /
analyzed: sgom par byed pas na ji ltar yongs su tshol ba dang rags pa /
translated: Since one cultivates that, it is the attention arisen from belief.

original: zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de dag la yang dang yang du zhi bar byed pa de ni de'i mos pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de dag la yang dang yang du zhi bar byed pa de ni de'i mos pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: Since one repeatedly pacifies those characteristics of coarseness and calmness that one has sought, it is the attention arisen from belief.

original: de kun du bsten zhing goms par byas pa lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus dang po kho na nyon mongs pa chen po spong ba'i lam skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de kun du bsten zhing goms par byas pa lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus dang po kho na nyon mongs pa chen po spong ba'i lam skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Through the cause of repeatedly cultivating and familiarizing oneself with that, the path that abandons the great afflictions arises for the first time.

original: lam de dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa de ni rab tu dben pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam de dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa de ni rab tu dben pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The attention that possesses that path is called the attention of complete seclusion.

original: des dang por 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs ba dang / de'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu spong ba la dga' ba dang / rab tu dben pa la dga' bar 'gyur zhing spong ba de la phan yon du mthong ba dang /
analyzed: des dang por 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs ba dang / de'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir de'i 'og tu spong ba la dga' ba dang / rab tu dben pa la dga' bar 'gyur zhing spong ba de la phan yon du mthong ba dang /
translated: Since that first abandons the afflictions of the desire realm and is free from the negative tendencies of that realm, after that one delights in abandonment and complete seclusion. One sees the benefits of that abandonment and,

original: rab tu dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang @106a * //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang @106a * //
translated: The joy that arises from perfect seclusion.üîΩ

original: bde ba chung ngu la reg nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bde ba chung ngu la reg nas 'di lta ste /
translated: He experiences the joy and pleasure born of seclusion.üîΩHe becomes filled with joy through the mental attention of faith at the proper time, in order to abandon sluggishness, drowsiness, and agitation.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod pa spang ba'i phyir dus su rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas kun du skyo bar byed pa de ni de'i dga'
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod pa spang ba'i phyir dus su rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa kun du skyo bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas kun du skyo bar byed pa de ni de'i dga'
translated: He becomes weary through the mental attention of weariness.

original: ba sdud pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba sdud pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the mental attention of joy and the mental attention of weariness.

original: de ltar spong ba'i dga' ba dang bsgom pa'i dga' ba la yang dag par rab tu brtson pa na rgyu'am gnas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de ltar spong ba'i dga' ba dang bsgom pa'i dga' ba la yang dag par rab tu brtson pa na rgyu'am gnas kyang rung ste /
translated: Thus, when he is correctly and thoroughly engaged in the joy of renunciation and the joy of cultivation, whether he is walking or sitting,üîΩhe does not arouse the envelopments of the mental afflictions that are desirous of obstructing the practice of virtue.

original: de la dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba la gegs byed par 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa kun du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba na de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba la gegs byed par 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa kun du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba na de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks to himself:

original: ci bdag la 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa la 'dun pa yin bzhin du mi myong ngam 'on te med pas mi myong snyam du sems te /
analyzed: ci bdag la 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa la 'dun pa yin bzhin du mi myong ngam 'on te med pas mi myong snyam du sems te /
translated: One thinks, Do I not experience desire for objects while having desire for objects? Or do I not experience it because they do not exist?üîΩOne who wishes to investigate this should direct the mind to any agreeable sign that inspires faith.

original: de yongs su dpyod par 'dod pas rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma sdu gu gang yang rung ba yid la byed de de'i bag la nyal thams cad kyi thams cad du spang ba'i phyir mtshan ma de yid la byed pa na bsten pa la gzhol ba
analyzed: de yongs su dpyod par 'dod pas rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma sdu gu gang yang rung ba yid la byed de de'i bag la nyal thams cad kyi thams cad du spang ba'i phyir mtshan ma de yid la byed pa na bsten pa la gzhol ba
translated: When one does this, one's mind becomes absorbed in and focused on that sign in order to abandon all latent propensities for desire.

original: dang / 'bab pa dang bab pa'i sems 'byung bar 'gyur zhing btang snyoms su mi gnas la /üîΩyid byung ba dang smod pa dang phyir ldog pa dang / mi mthun par mi gnas na 'di snyam du sems te /üîΩbdag gi sems ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dang / 'bab pa dang bab pa'i sems 'byung bar 'gyur zhing btang snyoms su mi gnas la / yid byung ba dang smod pa dang phyir ldog pa dang / mi mthun par mi gnas na 'di snyam du sems te / bdag gi sems ni 'di lta ste /
translated: One does not remain in equanimity but experiences a mind that is absorbed in and focused on that sign.

original: 'dod pa rnams las yang dag par 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol ba ma yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams las yang dag par 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol ba ma yin no snyam nas /
translated: One thinks, ‚ÄúMy mind is not free from desire for objects, that is, it is not completely free from desire.‚Äù

original: de bag la nyal de'i lhag ma lus pa rgya cher spang ba'i phyir bdag gi sems mngon par 'du byed pas mngon par zin pa dang chu bzhin du bcus pa dang / chos nyid kyis mngon par zin pa des spong ba ci la dga' ba dang /
analyzed: de bag la nyal de'i lhag ma lus pa rgya cher spang ba'i phyir bdag gi sems mngon par 'du byed pas mngon par zin pa dang chu bzhin du bcus pa dang / chos nyid kyis mngon par zin pa des spong ba ci la dga' ba dang /
translated: In order to completely abandon the remaining latent states of those afflictions, he thinks, ‚ÄúI will abide extensively in the delight of abandoning and in the delight of meditation by means of the mental application of analysis.

original: bsgom pa la dga' ba la rgya cher gnas par bya'o snyam pa de ni de'i dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa la dga' ba la rgya cher gnas par bya'o snyam pa de ni de'i dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚Äù This is called the mental application of analysis.

original: de de ltar spong ba la dga' ba dang bsgom pa la dga' la rgya cher gnas shing zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong bsgom pa la rab tu brtson par byed pa na yang dang yang du dpyod par byed cing de'i gnyen po sgom par byed de /
analyzed: de de ltar spong ba la dga' ba dang bsgom pa la dga' la rgya cher gnas shing zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong bsgom pa la rab tu brtson par byed pa na yang dang yang du dpyod par byed cing de'i gnyen po sgom par byed de /
translated: When he thus delights in abandoning and delights in meditation and abides extensively, and when he is striving to cultivate serenity and insight, he repeatedly analyzes and cultivates their antidotes.

original: dus dus su spangs pa dang ma spangs pa gnyis la dpyod par byed pa na /
analyzed: dus dus su spangs pa dang ma spangs pa gnyis la dpyod par byed pa na /
translated: From time to time, he analyzes both the abandonment and non-abandonment of those afflictions.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa @106b thams cad las re zhig tsam gyis tshul gyis sems 'bral bar byed cing /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa @106b thams cad las re zhig tsam gyis tshul gyis sems 'bral bar byed cing /
translated: It is the mind's temporary separation from all the afflictions of the desire realm.
